 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Chief Product Officer
description:
Key Responsibilities:
 * Define and execute the product strategy and roadmap, aligning with the company’s strategic goals and market opportunities.
* Lead the product management team in the planning, development, and execution of new products and enhancements to existing products.
* Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement, encouraging the development of market-leading products that meet customer needs.
* Collaborate with other C-level executives to integrate product strategies with company-wide initiatives, including marketing, sales, and technology.
* Conduct market research and analysis to stay ahead of industry trends and leverage insights in product development.
* Oversee the product lifecycle from concept through launch and beyond, ensuring products achieve planned goals.
* Engage with customers and key stakeholders to gather feedback and refine product offerings.
* Establish metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) for the product team, monitoring performance to ensure targets are met.


 Required Qualifications:
 * Proven experience as a CPO or in a similar senior product management role, preferably within the gaming, i-gaming, or fin-tech sectors.
* Demonstrated ability to lead a product team and drive product strategy in a competitive market.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make decisions based on both quantitative and qualitative data.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate ideas and persuade stakeholders.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications in product management are highly advantageous.

title: Art Director
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Role:** 
 Art Director
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**About the role:**
 We are collaborating with a global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Art Director. We're seeking an experienced creative visionary with over 5 years of experience in advertising, a strong background in art direction, and a passion for AI in creative processes. In this role, you'll collaborate across functions with a dynamic team of 15 professionals and contribute to ground-breaking campaigns that push creative boundaries.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Create and manage original, persuasive, conceptually compelling work for campaigns, content, and experiences with support from the Creative Director.
* Working proactive to push the brands to explore new creative expressions.
* Collaborate with on-site and in-house teams to explore ways to develop creative presence through innovative content.
* Develop creative output that is on-brand, innovative, challenging and attuned to the cultural interests of the audience.
* Ensure all concepts follow responsible communication guidelines.
* Help develop content calendars that support and extend marketing initiatives, identifying the most effective methods and channels for each sub-section of the target audience.
* Identify and build relationships with and bringing to fruition, collaborative projects with partner platforms, websites, influencers, and channels which, can extend the reach of the content and help deliver authentic experiences to the target audience.
* Supervise the teams to be an arbiter of best practices in terms of messaging, strategic targeting, and style.
* Work with the data and analytics teams to gauge content effectiveness and make recommendations based on those results.
* Demonstrated understanding and application of AI in creative processes, with a forward-thinking mindset towards emerging technologies.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**What you need to be great in this role:** 
  

  

* Extensive experience working with both luxury and commercial brands.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks & beverages sectors preferred.
* In-depth knowledge of fashion and lifestyle industries, with experience directing visual narratives.
* Demonstrated success leading and executing international campaigns for high-profile clients.
* Skill in developing tailored aesthetic concepts that resonate with sophisticated audiences.
* A helicopter view of the content world and emerging trends in social media communication.
* Hands-on design experience at leading creative studios.
* Strong foundation in graphic design and visual communication principles.
* Proven ability to co-create with photographers, stylists, partners, and fellow art directors.
* Experience managing end-to-end creative processes, from brand identity to campaign development.
* Expertise in motion-driven content creation and execution.
* Excellent portfolio of work that demonstrates high quality art direction and design within a variety of marketing campaign and platform projects.
* Strong layout and design skills across print and digital.
* Actively support the Creative Director with new business activity, networking and pitching where required.
* Experienced in liaising directly with the client and the ability to build strong relationships.
* Experience with strategic brainstorming, creative brief development, and creative execution.
* Experience meeting clients and presenting your work.
* Ability to think creatively and justify concepts to clients and team members.
* A helicopter view of the content world as well as emerging trends in social media communication
* A deep understanding of Editorial & Publishing models.
* A developed and working awareness of all major content platforms and channels and a view on new platforms.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks & beverages sectors preferred.
* 5+ years of relevant experience in
+ Digital
+ Print
+ Motion Graphics
+ Web Design
+ UX-UI
+ Artwork
+ Production


 Req ID: 13318
   

  

 Our values shape everything we do:
   

  

 Be
 **Ambitious** 
 to succeed
   

  

 Be
 **Imaginative** 
 to push the boundaries of what’s possible
   

  

 Be
 **Inspirational** 
 to do groundbreaking work
   

  

 Be
 **always learning and listening** 
 to understand
   

  

 Be
 **Results-focused** 
 to exceed expectations
   

  

 Be
 **actively pro-inclusive and anti-racist** 
 across our community, clients and creations
   

  

*OLIVER,* 
*a part of the Brandtech Group, is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodivergence, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.*
*OLIVER has set ambitious environmental goals around sustainability, with science-based emissions reduction targets. Collectively, we work towards our mission, embedding sustainability into every department and through every stage of the project lifecycle.*

* An innate creative flair, interested in art direction and in developing concepting skills

title: Product manager – Machine and Equipment Tracking
description:
**Are you ready to shape the future of smart asset tracking across Europe?** 
 At ABAX, we help businesses with mobile workforces work smarter — cutting costs, improving efficiency, and driving sustainability. Now, we’re growing fast and looking for a Product Manager to take full ownership of one of our most exciting product areas: Machine & Equipment Tracking.
   

  

 As
 **Product Manager,** 
 you’ll sit at the heart of an empowered, cross-functional team — defining strategy, guiding execution, and owning outcomes. This is your chance to lead a product that blends IoT innovation with tangible, real-world impact. From construction tools to heavy machinery, you’ll help businesses track and manage assets with precision and intelligence.
   

  

 We’re seeking someone with a strong, hands-on product management background — ideally with experience aligning product strategy to commercial goals. You know how to balance user needs, technical feasibility, and business value — and you're passionate about creating products that drive growth and customer success.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and lead the product strategy in alignment with ABAX’s broader goals
* Leverage data and market insights to identify customer pain points and solve real problems
* Drive the product lifecycle end to end — from concept to launch and beyond
* Collaborate closely with engineering, UX, and commercial teams
* Own and iterate the product roadmap — delivering value early and often
* Create clear, outcome-focused user stories and champion seamless user experiences


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience scaling B2B cloud products as a Product Manager
* A relevant degree in technology, engineering, or a related field
* Solid understanding of both hardware and software, ideally with insight into the machine & equipment domain
* Enthusiastic, innovative, customer-obsessed, and sustainability-minded
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to work across discipline


**What You’ll Gain**
* End-to-end ownership of a rapidly scaling product
* A visible, influential role shaping product development and company impact
* Opportunity to work with scalable solutions and future-ready technology
* A strong company culture based on accountability, trust, and teamwork


**Other Information**
* Start date: As soon as possible
* Work extent: Full-time
* Location: Stockholm. Hybrid working available.


**Background Check And Reference Verification**
 Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.
   

  

 Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.
   

  

**About ABAX**
 ABAX is a leading European telematics IoT platform offering connected mobility solutions for vehicle tracking, tool tracking, and equipment control. Our mission is to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less.
   

  

 With over 500,000 tracked assets and 40,000 customers, ABAX delivers reliable and powerful solutions for businesses relying on physical operations. Our advanced platform transforms customer needs into actionable insights and automated reporting, driving efficiency and operational excellence.
   

  

 We operate across Europe, with close to 300 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

title: Member of Technical Staff
description:
**📖 Why Bluebook** 


 At
 
**Bluebook** 

 , we're reinventing accounting from the ground up using AI. Our mission is to give accounting firms a fleet of intelligent agents that automate the books and accelerate advisory. That means putting the busywork on autopilot so accountants can focus on judgment, insight, and strategy.
 




  






 We’re backed by
 
**EQT Ventures** 

 ,
 
**Y Combinator** 

 , and top minds from
 
**OpenAI,** 


**Eleven Labs** 

 , and
 
**Affirm** 

 , and we’re scaling fast. Founded in 2024 by experts in accounting and engineering, Bluebook is headquartered in Sweden with a globally distributed team.
 




  




**👤  The role** 


 We’re looking for
 
**Product-focused Members of the Technical Staff** 

 to help us shape and ship the next generation of agentic interfaces and financial tools. Whether you're a
 
**sharp, hungry engineer in your early career** 

 , or a
 
**seasoned product builder with experience at scale** 

 , you'll work in tight loops with the founding team to design, test, and ship end-to-end features that make accounting smarter and more human.
 




  






 You’ll write code—but more than that, you’ll help define
 
**what should be built** 

 , not just how.
   





**Depending on your experience, you will:** 
* Build and refine
 
**agent interfaces** 

 that feel intuitive, assistive, and trustworthy with an eye for product/UX quality
* Scope and prototype accounting workflows, such as prepaids, monthly close etc, as
 
**chatbots** 

 and
 
**ambient agents**
* Work closely with users to
 
**test prototypes** 

 , validate feature ideas, and improve interactions
* Help define technical direction, architecture, and reusable design patterns (senior)
* Work autonomously to
 
**ship full-stack features** 

 from idea to production



  




**You might thrive in this role if you have:** 
* Have 3–15 years of experience building full-stack or frontend-heavy products
* Are fluent in
 
**TypeScript** 

 , and comfortable with
 
**React/Next.js** 

 , and/or
 
**Python**
* Love working close to product: you care about interface quality, UX polish, and user impact
* Thrive in
 
**ambiguity** 

 , you like defining scope, not just following tickets
* For
 
**seniors** 

 : you’ve led architecture, scaled infra, or mentored across teams
* For
 
**mid-levels** 

 : you’ve taken features from idea to code, maybe even in a small startup or consulting environment



  




**🖥️ Our Tech Stack** 
* Frontend: React (TypeScript)
* Backend: Bun with TypeScript (tRPC)
* Data: Python + Inngest (PubSub)
* Cloud & Infrastructure: Vercel, Render & Supabase
* Storage & Search: Postgres with pgvector & Redis
* Design: Figma



  




**🤝 What's in it for you?** 


 This is a rare chance to build agents that reshape a fundamental industry. You'll work in a lean, curious, and values-driven team where autonomy and initiative are celebrated.
 




  






 We also offer:
 



* Competitive compensation
* A generous employee stock options (ESOPs) programme
* You chose your own work equipment & tools
* Wellness allowance
* Health insurance

title: Konsult team - Vidareutveckling och förvaltning av webbplatform
description:
Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vi är ett konsultföretag med ett gäng teknikintresserade och glada människor!
   

  

 Vi älskar teknik, vi älskar design och vi älskar kvalitet. Vår mångfald gör oss unika och skapar en inkluderande och välkomnande arbetsplats där varje individ är högt värderad.
   

  

 Hos oss är varje individ sig själv och respekterar andra för den de är. Vi tror att när en fantastisk mix av människor samlas och delar sin kunskap, sina erfarenheter och idéer, kan vi hjälpa våra kunder på en helt annan nivå.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som kan börja omgående och vill växa med oss!
   

  

 Hos oss har du stora möjligheter att ta verkliga kliv i din karriär och chansen att ta stort ansvar.
   

  

 Jobbeskrivning
   

  

 Vi söker ett konsultteam som kan stödja, vidareutveckla och förvalta multiwebblösningen regionstockholm.se. Fokus ligger på användarcentrerad utveckling, tillgänglighet, SEO, UX och teknisk arkitektur.
   

  

 Uppdraget innebär bl.a.:
   

  

* Förvaltning och utveckling av webbtjänster baserade på Optimizely i Azure, med React och Next.js
* Konsolidering av befintliga lösningar
* Samarbete i agila team enligt Scrum, sprintar om 2–3 veckor
* Tätt samarbete med Region Stockholms webbteam och övriga arbetsgrupper


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Krav på konsulterna:**
 Ett team som omfattar följande kompetenser. En person kan omfatta flera kompetensområden och teamet kommer variera mellan 5-8 personer på deltid eller heltid, utifrån behov. Uppdraget omfattar i genomsnitt 4 personer på heltid.
   

  

**Ska-krav:**
 minst
 **5 års erfarenhet** 
 inom den roll de offereras som:
   

  

* UX-designer
* Innehållsstrateg/UX-copy
* Konceptutvecklare
* Art Director
* Tillgänglighetsspecialist
* Kravanalytiker
* SEO-specialist
* Projektledare
* Systemarkitekt/lösningsarkitekt
* Integrationsarkitekt
* Systemutvecklare (frontend och backend)
* Testare


**Bör-krav (Mervärdeskrav):**
 För nedan markerade roller krävs minst
 **10 års erfarenhet** 
 för att poängsättas i presentationen:
   

  

* UX-designer
* Innehållsstrateg/UX-copy
* SEO-specialist
* Systemarkitekt/Lösningsarkitekt
* Systemutvecklare (frontend/backend)


 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Referensuppdrag ska vara maximalt en A4-sida per uppdrag, samt:
   

  

* Bifogade CV och tre referensuppdrag för varje roll
* Utförda senaste 3 åren
* Relevanta i omfattning och komplexitet
* Från olika kunder, minst en offentlig verksamhet


**Kompetensnivå:** 
 3–5
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Note:** 
***Please apply only if you are in Sweden***

title: Senior Product Manager - Growth
description:
Intro
   

  

 At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.
   

  

 Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation - which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our Customer Retention and Monetisation team at Pleo. In this role, you'll continuously maximize customer value to drive retention, expansion, and long-term growth as we scale our PLG motion. If you're excited about building cutting-edge product-led journeys to unlock tangible value and are passionate about experimentation, customer growth strategies, and the future of Fin-tech, then this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Please note: We are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role in any of the listed locations you find in the job info.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As a Senior Product Manager, you will:
   

  

* Lead initiatives to continuously maximise customer value across trials, upgrades, downgrades, and billing, scaling our PLG motion
* Deeply analyse user behaviour through data (SQL, product analytics, CRM) to identify key cohorts, engagement patterns, and opportunities for growth
* Design and execute experiments to optimise conversion rates for trials, upgrades, and feature adoption
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and Data Science to align on strategies and ensure seamless execution of growth initiatives
* Own the Retention and Monetisation roadmap, translating user insights and business goals into actionable product journeys and feature development
* Iterate on pricing and packaging, working hand in hand with our Pricing expert, exploring new strategies to optimise monetisation
* Conduct qualitative user research (interviews, surveys) to deeply understand user needs and pain points related to product usage and value perception


 What you bring
   

  

 You’ll thrive in this role if you have:
   

  

* A strong analytical mindset and proficiency in data analysis tools like SQL, Excel, and product analytics platforms (e.g. Amplitude)
* Proven product management experience in a Product-Led Growth (PLG) environment, with a solid understanding of the full product development lifecycle
* A results-oriented growth mindset, comfortable with ambiguity and a relentless drive for measurable outcomes through experimentation
* Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, able to articulate complex ideas and influence diverse teams.
* Deep customer empathy and proven experience conducting user research to translate insights into tangible product improvements
* Strong business acumen with an understanding of SaaS business models, unit economics, and key financial metrics (LTV, churn)
* Experience with iterating on pricing and packaging strategies


 Who you’ll be working with and reporting to
   

  

 You’ll report to our PLG Director and work closely with teams within PLG, our GTM functions like Marketing, Rev Ops, Sales and CS, as well as closely with other Product teams. Our team of 14 is highly collaborative and dedicated to Product Led Customer Growth. You’ll also have the chance to partner with teams across Data and Pricing to ensure success.
   

  

 How you’ll develop in this role
   

  

 In your first 3 months at Pleo, you’ll:
   

  

* Lead the Retention and Monetisation Strategy creation to drive impact our ambitious customer growth efforts
* Collaborate with Product Marketing, Sales and Pricing to improve our positioning of our paid plans, by launching rapid, hypothesis-driven experiments.
* Grow your skills in your craft, taking on new challenges as the company continues to scale


 We’re committed to helping you develop your career, whether that means taking on bigger projects, stepping into leadership, or acquiring new skills in Product Led Growth.
   

  

 Show me the benefits!
   

  

* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
* Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
* We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
* For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: Technical Designer - ARC Raiders
description:
We are looking for a Technical Designer to join ARC Raiders game teams here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering ~100 developers.
   

  

 In this role you will be responsible for the technical design work by creating, implementing, and maintaining tools, systems, & other workflows as a bridge between design and code.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with the Design Director and other Designers of the project, as well as Production leadership helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Help design and prove new features by developing prototypes for the design team to experiment with
* Help identify technical pitfalls and challenges in our designs, offering possible solutions or alternatives
* Contribute tool and workflow improvement ideas, especially design tools
* Help design, balance, and tweak our more technical gameplay systems, for example activity spawning or loot distribution
* Work with other disciplines to help align design intent with non-design pipelines and tech


**We would love if you have**
* Around 5+ years of experience within technical design making games
* A good grasp of AAA PvP/PvE gameplay and systems design, including player psychology, UX design, and gameplay mechanics & dynamics
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience in scripting and blueprints
* Knowledge of the UnrealEngine-Angelscript plugin is a big plus, but not required
* Knowledge of programming languages such as C#, Lua, or Python
* A creative and curious mind
* A good knowledge or familiarity with other game making disciplines such as animation, UX, 3D Art, etc.
* A great creative collaborator in cross disciplinary groups
* Professional English communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Product manager – Machine and Equipment Tracking
description:
**Are you ready to shape the future of smart asset tracking across Europe?** 
 At ABAX, we help businesses with mobile workforces work smarter — cutting costs, improving efficiency, and driving sustainability. Now, we’re growing fast and looking for a Product Manager to take full ownership of one of our most exciting product areas: Machine & Equipment Tracking.
   

  

 As
 **Product Manager,** 
 you’ll sit at the heart of an empowered, cross-functional team — defining strategy, guiding execution, and owning outcomes. This is your chance to lead a product that blends IoT innovation with tangible, real-world impact. From construction tools to heavy machinery, you’ll help businesses track and manage assets with precision and intelligence.
   

  

 We’re seeking someone with a strong, hands-on product management background — ideally with experience aligning product strategy to commercial goals. You know how to balance user needs, technical feasibility, and business value — and you're passionate about creating products that drive growth and customer success.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and lead the product strategy in alignment with ABAX’s broader goals
* Leverage data and market insights to identify customer pain points and solve real problems
* Drive the product lifecycle end to end — from concept to launch and beyond
* Collaborate closely with engineering, UX, and commercial teams
* Own and iterate the product roadmap — delivering value early and often
* Create clear, outcome-focused user stories and champion seamless user experiences


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience scaling B2B cloud products as a Product Manager
* A relevant degree in technology, engineering, or a related field
* Solid understanding of both hardware and software, ideally with insight into the machine & equipment domain
* Enthusiastic, innovative, customer-obsessed, and sustainability-minded
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to work across discipline


**What You’ll Gain**
* End-to-end ownership of a rapidly scaling product
* A visible, influential role shaping product development and company impact
* Opportunity to work with scalable solutions and future-ready technology
* A strong company culture based on accountability, trust, and teamwork


**Other Information**
* Start date: As soon as possible
* Work extent: Full-time
* Location: Stockholm. Hybrid working available.


**Background check and Reference verification:**
 Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.
   

  

 Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities:**
 At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.
   

  

**About ABAX:**
 ABAX is a leading European telematics IoT platform offering connected mobility solutions for vehicle tracking, tool tracking, and equipment control. Our mission is to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less.
   

  

 With over 500,000 tracked assets and 40,000 customers, ABAX delivers reliable and powerful solutions for businesses relying on physical operations. Our advanced platform transforms customer needs into actionable insights and automated reporting, driving efficiency and operational excellence.
   

  

 We operate across Europe, with close to 300 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Stockholm - E-Commerce** 




  





 We're working with a cutting-edge e-commerce startup backed by world-class investors. Our client is building a creative merchandising app that transforms how fashion and lifestyle brands curate their online stores.
 



  





 They're now building a new product, a GPT-Search function for e-commerce stores and are looking for an ML Engineer to drive this product and take ownership.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Lead the design and development of a new AI-powered search tool that replaces traditional search bars with a smart, conversational interface.
* Build and improve systems like RAG pipelines, semantic search, reranking, and personalisation for e-commerce.
* Quickly prototype and launch features based on real feedback from merchants and shoppers.
* Work closely with founders, product managers, and engineers to create a seamless shopping experience.
* Take full ownership of machine learning components—from testing ideas to deploying them—including prompt design, fine-tuning, evaluation, and speed optimisation.
* Explore new models and APIs to find the best balance between performance, cost, and user experience.
* Help shape how the AI system adapts to different merchants, balancing automation with brand-specific customisation.
* Play a key role in shaping the team’s engineering culture—how we experiment, learn, and move fast together.



  





**Who you are** 



* You think like a founder—comfortable building quick prototypes, taking on different roles, and navigating uncertainty.
* You're excited about the fast-moving world of AI, especially LLMs, vector search, and conversational interfaces, and want to apply them in real products.
* You’ve worked on machine learning products in production, ideally involving smart search, personalised results, or large-scale model use.
* You thrive in fast-paced environments where priorities shift and builders make the biggest impact.
* You care more about making things happen than following rigid processes
* You’re practical—you’ll test prompts before training models and launch early versions before perfecting them.
* Bonus points if you’ve worked on e-commerce search, fine-tuned foundation models, or used tools like FAISS, Weaviate, LangChain, or OpenAI APIs.



  





**In Return** 



* Competitive salary and equity
* 4000 SEK in annual wellness allowance
* 30 paid vacation days
* Work from our office in Stockholm or full-time remote
* Monthly co-working allowance if remote-based
* Annual learning allowance
* Company Laptop
* Fun Quarterly off-sites



  





 This is a great opportunity to be part of a financially secure and solid working culture where you can make a significant impact on this product and its growth.
 



  





 Apply now or contact me for more information.
 



  





 j.wright@tenthrevolution.com
 



 +46 77 586 81 88

title: CPO till ClearOn
description:
Vill du vara med och leda produktutvecklingen i ett dynamiskt företag som står inför spännande tillväxtmöjligheter? Vi söker en erfaren och strategisk ledare till rollen som CPO (Head of Product) till ClearOn.
   

  

 Som CPO kommer du att ansvara för att forma och genomföra bolagets produktvision och leda ett team bestående av produktchefer och produktägare. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i ClearOn:s fortsatta tillväxt och ingå i företagets ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att driva produktvisionen på ledningsnivå och samarbeta tätt med CEO och ledningsgruppen för att utveckla och förverkliga företagets strategi. Du är ansvarig för hela produktportföljen, inklusive affärsutveckling och innovation, med fokus på att säkerställa ClearOns kommersiella framgång och fortsatta utveckling.
   

  

 ClearOn:s kontor är beläget i Liljeholmen och du kommer rapportera till CEO.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**
* Definiera och genomföra en produktvision i linje med företagets mål och affärsstrategi.
* Ansvara för ClearOns produkter och tjänster samt deras P&L.
* Leda och coacha ett team av produktchefer och produktägare för att främja en kultur av innovation och samarbete.
* Ansvara för att produktvision och roadmap skall möta dagens och morgondagens behov.
* Säkerställa effektiv kommunikation mellan olika avdelningar och produktteamet.
* Hantera produktutvecklingsprocesser för att säkerställa högkvalitativ och tidsenlig leverans.


**Kvalifikationer:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom produktledning, varav minst 2 år med ledarskap över produktchefer.
* Starka ledarskapsförmågor och erfarenhet av att inspirera och motivera team i snabbrörliga tekniska miljöer.
* Gedigen erfarenhet inom produktutveckling, marknadsföring och djup förståelse för SaaS-lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av datadriven produktutveckling, A/B-testning och användarundersökningar.
* Kunskap om agila metoder och SCRUM-ramverket.
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom FMCG.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har förmåga att översätta marknadsbehov till strategiska produktplaner och balansera kortsiktiga och långsiktiga mål.
* Är lösningsorienterad, drivande och målinriktad med en stark förmåga att anpassa dig till förändringar.


**Om ClearOn**
 ClearOn är Sveriges marknadsledande partner för säljdrivande kampanjer både i butik och digital närvaro inom dagligvaru- och servicehandeln med över 50 års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Vi är en full servicepartner inom säljdrivande lösningar där vi erbjuder innovativa tekniska lösningar och interaktiva kampanjer som skapar engagemang och försäljning i butik.
   

  

 Vi arbetar utifrån ett 360 graders perspektiv och erbjuder strategisk rådgivning och analys och driver långsiktig tillväxt genom unika och konkurrenskraftiga erbjudanden och tjänster i strävan att nå vårt mål som en komplett partner för att förstå, aktivera och sammanföra varumärken med konsumenter.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar ClearOn med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.
   

  

 Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.
   

  

 #IT

title: Senior Fullstack and Design Engineer -  Schibsted User Identity
description:
We are looking to grow our team with a full stack engineer with interest in Design Systems.
   

  

**Who we are:**
 Our democracies depend on independent journalism. At Schibsted, we provide the technology behind some of the leading media brands in the Nordics - products that reach millions of people every day.
   

  

 The User Identity team builds essential services like login, account management, and consent handling, enabling our users to engage safely and meaningfully across all Schibsted platforms.
   

  

 We're growing, and we’re especially eager to bring in new perspectives that reflect our broad audience.
   

  

**What we do:**
 We’re a cross-functional, product-focused team with end-to-end ownership of key user identity services. You’ll work with engineers, designers, and product managers to solve meaningful problems, ranging from compliance and privacy to UX and performance. We work collaboratively with pairing, code reviews, and async-friendly rituals
   

  

* We dedicate 10% of our time (every second Friday) to learning, experimenting, or sharing knowledge
* We take part in company-wide hackathons and contribute to internal learning communities
* We aim to follow Agile principles in a way that supports our team autonomy


**Our Tech stack:**
 We mostly use JavaScript / TypeScript in our products, with Node, React and Github Actions, we leverage AWS services (MKS, Lambda, SNS / SQS). We use tools like Figma and Storybook to manage our designs.
   

  

**About you:**
 We are now looking for a full stack developer who has solid experience in frontend development and has a passion for Design Systems.
   

  

* You have a deep knowledge of JavaScript (React, Node.js, TypeScript)
* You have experience in Design tools (Figma, Storybook)
* You have a solid knowledge of optimization of user interface performance and responsiveness
* You have experience or interest in establishing and maintaining Design Systems
* You have a good understanding of the concepts of and/or experience with continuous deployment, integration and unit tests, documentation and GitHub.


**What we offer:**
* A team culture that puts learning and growth at the center - we dedicate 10% of our time (every second Friday) to skill-building, collaboration, and experimentation
* Opportunities to shape how design systems and identity services evolve across the company
* A flexible work setup that supports both focus time and collaboration, with hybrid working as the norm.
* The chance to work on high-impact products used across leading media brands in the Nordics

title: Helpdesk Technician Vitec Group IT
description:
As Helpdesk Technician, you will be part of Vitec Group IT, a team of 27 dedicated people responsible for the IT environment and our data centers in Vitec Software Group. Vitec is a leading software provider with 46 business units in several countries in Northern Europe, that delivers business critical software for a number of industries that are important to society. Our more than 25000 customers depend on our software to be up and running. And our more than 1600 employees depend on Vitec IT to have their computers up and running. We are now looking for a new colleague to the helpdesk team. Are you structured, service-oriented and good at problem solving? Then it may be you we are looking for to contribute with your expertise and positive attitude in our team.
  
Our offer
  
Your main tasks include 1st and 2nd line support within our Microsoft-based environment as well as to our MacOS-based users. You will manage cases through a case management system and take full responsibility for analyzing, assessing and resolving cases from start to finish. You will work both independently and in close collaboration with your colleagues to solve problems in the best possible way. The customers will be users from different companies and countries, using different IT environments and technologies.
  
With us, you get a secure employment in an exciting international company in growth and constant development, where you can grow professionally.
  
What we are looking for
  
It is important that you are pedagogical and have good prioritization skills as well as the ability to coordinate many simultaneous assignments. We believe in a close dialogue with our users, and it is therefore important that you are service-oriented and enjoy communicating with people at all times.
  
You have previous experience from similar tasks, while you are looking forward to developing and learning new things in the field. You probably have an education in IT and a high interest in technology as well as the ability to provide good service in a professional way.
  
As you will support users in all our countries of operation, you need to be fluent in English, both orally and in writing. You also need to be fluent in either Dutch, Finnish or Swedish.
  
Does this sound interesting?
  
If you want to know more, you are welcome to contact Thomas Andersson on thomas.andersson@vitecsoftware.com or +46 90 200 65 04. Since we are in a bit of a summer mood, please text me and I will call you back.
  
We hope that we have raised your interest! Make your application in English no later than Aug 31st, 2025.
  
We look forward to receiving your application!
  
About Vitec Software Group
  
Vitec is a leading provider of Vertical Software and has its origin and headquarters in Umeå, Sweden. Our products have been developed to meet specific needs within various niche markets in society. The expertise of our employees, combined with our shared corporate culture and business model, enable continuous improvement and innovation. We grow through the successes of our business units, as well as through acquisitions. Everything we do is based on a long-term perspective. Because we are to rely on – today and tomorrow. Vitec has 1,660 employees, is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm and had net sales of SEK 3,334 million in 2024. Read more at vitecsoftware.com.

title: System Engineer - IT Security Specialist
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*


Din roll


I den här rollen kommer du ingå i ett team av ingenjörer som arbetar fokuserat med informationssäkerhet, både internt mot våra utvecklingsavdelningar och externt mot kund. Här spelar du en viktig roll i arbetet med att planera informationssäkerhetsarbetet i projektet samt designa säkerhetsarkitekturen för våra system. Du arbetar nära produktutvecklare, systemingenjörer och verifieringsingenjörer.


Genom ditt engagemang bidrar du till att utveckla och förbättra våra lösningar inom informationssäkerhet, så att vi effektivt kan hantera nya intrångshot och möta kundernas krav. Rollen präglas av samarbete och laganda, där du blir en värdefull del av ett team som tillsammans stärker verksamheten inom säkerhetsområdet.


Dina huvuduppgifter innefattar:

* Löpande kommunikation med bland annat kunder, projektledare, systemingenjörer, produktledare och utvecklare
* Risk- och sårbarhetsanalys
* Kravnedbrytning och kravanalys
* IT-säkerhetsarkitektur med inriktning mot Cloud-lösningar


Vi erbjuder en bred uppdragsportfölj och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter – både inom teknik och ledarskap. Här får du en kreativ plattform att växa i, utifrån din egen riktning.


Din profil


För att trivas i rollen ser vi gärna att du är målmedveten och motiverad att ständigt ta dig an nya utmaningar för att både utveckla dig själv och bidra till verksamhetens framgång. Du kan arbeta självständigt och ta eget ansvar, samtidigt som du trivs med att samarbeta och bidra i team. Vidare är du välorganiserad och har ett starkt intresse för att fördjupa dig i tekniska lösningar.


Det här ser vi gärna att du har med dig:

* Kandidat/masterutbildning inom datavetenskap, högskole-/civilingenjörsexamen inom datateknik eller liknande, gärna med inriktning mot informationssäkerhet.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom t.ex teknisk kommunikationssäkerhet, riskhantering, systemutveckling, mjukvaruutveckling.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift.


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:

* Standarder inom informationssäkerhet som tex ISO/IEC 27000
* IT-säkerhetsutveckling enligt KSF, NIST eller motsvarande standard
* Design av IT-säkerhet för system
* Governance och compliance inom informationssäkerhet
* Penetrationstestning t.ex CEH
* Relevanta certifieringar tex CISSP, CSSLP


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.

  

Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.

  

Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.

  

Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.


Vänligen observera att urvalsarbetet påbörjas efter semestertiderna, men du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan nu!
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Embedded Software Architect på det medarbetarägda...
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu **Embedded Software Architect** som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt. Vi bygger med ambitionen att ta ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.


Som **Embedded Software Architect** kommer du leda och skapa tekniska lösningar för embedded system, inklusive design av hård- och mjukvaruarkitektur som uppfyller både prestandakrav och systemkrav. Vidare kommer du även utvärdera och rekommendera verktyg och teknologier som Yocto, Linux, RTOS, och C/C++ för att säkerställa att de bästa lösningarna används för projektet. Som konsult kommer du dessutom arbeta nära kunder för att förstå deras specifika behov, ge teknisk rådgivning och skräddarsydda lösningar, samt anpassa projekt och resurser för att uppfylla deras krav och förväntningar.

  

I den här rollen kommer du tillhöra enheten Things som är TechSeeds nystartade hårdvaruenhet med fokus på allting hårdvarunära, exempelvis Mekanik- och Elektronikdesign, konstruktion samt Embedded-mjukvara. Uppdragen kan även inkludera exempelvis testning samt automatiserad kod- och testgenerering, Automotive, Cybersäkerhet och även beröra elektronik, mekanik och DSP. Enheten är en central del i TechSeeds vision av att ta ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.

  


**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig vars expertis är embeddedutveckling! Som konsult kommer vi anpassa uppdragen utifrån dina intressen och din kompetens, med grunden stabilt i Embedded-världen. För att trivas i rollen behöver du ha minst fem års erfarenhet av embeddedutveckling och ha erfarenhet i rollen som arkitekt. Du har god erfarenhet av exempelvis bare metal, embedded Linux/Yocto, RTOS, C och C++ men har även ett stort intresse för att lära dig nya tekniker och miljöer. Du trivs i en konsultmässig roll där flexibilitet, kundfokus och förmåga att ta egna initiativ är avgörande för framgång. Vi ser gärna att du är en problemlösare som har ett proaktivt tillvägagångssätt och har vana av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.

  

Uppdrag kan variera men vi söker dig som vill designa, bygga, testa och leverera mjuk- och hårdvara till inbyggda system. Vi söker dig som intresseras av dessa områden och är van att arbeta nära kund genom hela utvecklingsprocessen, från beställning till leverans och uppföljning. Du arbetar metodiskt och strukturerat samt tar för självklart att dokumentera och testa löpande och noggrant.

**Om TechSeed**


Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda **delägarskap** till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår **kultur** och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora **tekniska intresse** med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoren. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som **Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies** och **Smart Buildings**.


Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:

* Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
* En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
* Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
* Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
* Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.
* Bra pensioner, försäkringar och 5000kr i friskvård

title: Enhetschef med inriktning automation
description:
**Om tjänsten**
---------------


Ansök senast: 17 augusti 2025


Kommun:
Lund
Omfattning:
Heltid
Antal sökande:
1
Antal tjänster:
1
Anställningsform:
Tillsvidareanställning
Varaktighet:
Tillsvidare
Tillträde:
Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
Referensnummer:
C269073
  
Gör skillnad. Varje dag.


Vill du ta ledningen för ett tekniskt kunnigt team och spela en avgörande roll i vår digitala transformation? Vi söker nu en enhetschef med fokus på att säkerställa, utveckla intelligent automation och förvalta hållbara lösningar för Region Skånes verksamheter. Det här är en roll för dig som brinner för teknik, automation och innovation i en modern IT-miljö.


Förvaltningen Digitalisering IT och MT bildades i januari 2020 och ger stöd och service till den skånska hälso- och sjukvården samt alla andra verksamheter inom Region Skåne. Förvaltningens uppdrag är att införa en modern och sammanhållen digital vårdmiljö parallellt med drift och effektiv konsolidering av dagens befintliga IT-miljö. Vi möjliggör arbetet med digitalisering och införande av nya arbetssätt i Region Skånes verksamheter.


Vi erbjuder dig ett nyckeluppdrag i hjärtat av organisationens digitala förändringsresa. Du får leda ett kompetent team i en modern plattformsmiljö, där fokus ligger på teknisk stabilitet, utveckling och kvalitet. Vi tror på tydligt ledarskap, öppen kultur och teknisk excellens.


Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta som chef i Region Skåne:https://www.skane.se/jobb-och-utbildning/jobba-hos-oss/utvecklas-med-oss/arbeta-som-chef/


Välkommen till oss!  

  



**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------


Som enhetschef leder du ett team av teknikspecialister och utvecklare inom ramen för plattformens tekniska förvaltning. Tillsammans ansvarar ni för att förvalta, vidareutveckla och driftsätta lösningar baserade på de krav som definierats inom ramen för digital verksamhetsutveckling.


Du har ett helhetsansvar för personal, verksamhet och ekonomi, och rapporterar till områdeschefen. Du ingår i ledningsgruppen för Digital verksamhetsutveckling och deltar även regelbundet i ledningsgruppen för verksamhetsområdet Digital transformation. Som enhetschef har du stort fokus på att coacha och utveckla dina medarbetare samt skapa goda förutsättningar för lärande och innovation.


I ditt uppdrag ansvarar du för att säkerställa god samverkan mellan teknik, kravställning och verksamhet. Samt att bidra till utveckling av automationsstrategi, metoder och arbetssätt. Du ansvarar även för plattformsdrift, utveckling och teknisk förvaltning.


Rollen innebär ett leverans- och teknikorienterat ledarskap, där du får möjlighet att både leda och forma arbetet med plattformsutveckling i en dynamisk och framtidsinriktad miljö.


Enheten i stort ansvarar för att säkerställa en stabil, hållbar och modern digital miljö i ServiceNow-plattformen. Ditt team fokuserar på:

* Utveckling och teknisk lösning samt att ge tekniskt stöd inom digitalisering, automation och plattformsutveckling.
* Driftsättning och övergång till produktion, där ni planerar och säkerställer smidiga driftsättningar samt överlämning till förvaltning.
* Förvaltning och support.
* Omvärldsbevakning, där ni följer den tekniska utvecklingen av automation och bidrar till plattformens modernisering och framtida kapacitet.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi söker dig som har:  

* Universitetsutbildning inom teknik, systemvetenskap eller IT eller annan relevant utbildning och arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdiga.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i båda tal och skrift.
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap inom IT och automation.
* Kunskap om intelligent automation, drift och utveckling gärna inom ServiceNow eller liknande plattformar.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt samt teknik- eller digitaliseringsprojektledning.

Som person har du en god förmåga att kommunicera och göra komplexa saker lättbegripliga för andra. Vidare är du strukturerad, lösningsfokuserad och ser positivt på förändringar. Stor vikt kommer läggas vid personlig lämplighet.


Hoppas vi har fångat ditt intresse!


Första intervjuer planeras att hållas i Lund under vecka 35 och 36.
  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!


**Övrigt**
----------


Region Skåne finns till för att alla som bor i Skåne ska må bra och känna framtidstro. Genom gränslösa samarbeten och omtanke skapas de bästa förutsättningar för ett hälsosamt liv inom näringsliv, kollektivtrafik, kultur och hälso- och sjukvård i Skåne. Tillsammans gör vi livet mera möjligt.


Förvaltningen Digitalisering IT och MT ger stöd och service till den skånska hälso- och sjukvården. Förvaltningens uppdrag är att införa en modern och sammanhållen digital vårdmiljö parallellt med drift och effektiv konsolidering av dagens befintliga IT-miljö. I uppdraget ingår förvaltning och support av befintliga och kommande system. Medicinsk teknik (MT) arbetar även med service, underhåll, inköp och egentillverkning av medicinteknisk utrustning.  

Förvaltningen ansvarar också för de grundläggande vårdinformationssystemen och driver utvecklingen av framtidens vårdinformation. Vi är cirka 350 medarbetare i förvaltningen och finns vid samtliga sjukhusområden i Skåne med huvudsäte i Lund.


På https://www.skane.se/ledigajobb kan du se i vilket skede Region Skånes rekryteringar befinner sig och hur många som har sökt tjänsterna.


Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser

  

**Kontaktperson**
-----------------

### **Åse Berneblad**

Områdeschef, VO Digital transformation
 E-post: Ase.Berneblad@skane.se
### **Hanna Skanne**

Rekryterare (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen)
 E-post: hanna.skanne@skane.se
 Telefon: 046-27 59 645
**Fackliga företrädare**
------------------------

### **Madeleine Payter**

Vision
 Telefon: madeleine.payter@skane.se

title: AUTOSAR Software Engineer (automotive)
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.


**Long Description**
--------------------

**Your Role**  

As an AUTOSAR Software Engineer, you will be involved in developing low-level software for various vehicle functions with an emphasis on system safety platforms within the Automotive Industry.
  

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*  

  

* Software development within DIM/DHU will be an advantage.
* Implement solution analysis and determine product implementation recommendations.
* Perform project documentation and progress reports.
* Provide on-site support for troubleshooting during the launch phase.

  

**Your Profile**  

We are now looking for an individual who has excellent skills in C++ and is passionate about development and thrives in a hands-on working environment.
  

  

To be successful in this role, we are happy to see that you have:
  

  

* 6+ years of automotive background.
* MSc/BSc within Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Signal Processing, Mechatronics, or similar.
* Excellent C++ programming skills and a minimum of three years of system software design experience.
* Experience from Automotive Domain (AUTOSAR).

What we believe you will enjoy about working here
  

  

* Innovative Projects: Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.
* Top-Notch Tools: Access the latest tools and technologies, from modeling software to configuration wizards, empowering you to excel in your craft.
* Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.
* Continuous Growth: Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities, staying ahead of the curve in the ever-evolving AUTOSAR landscape.

  

**Application and Contact**  

Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now since we assign roles during the whole application time span. For questions and for more information, contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, at 0725-616900.
  

Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
  

We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.
  

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*  

  

**About Capgemini**  

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
  

  

**Get The Future You Want** | www.capgemini.com

title: Software Engineer (Scala), Remote
description:
Everything we do is for our customers!

  

Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a unified commerce experience that our customers need, transforming ecommerce, retail, marketing automation, merchandising, helpdesk and AI operations with one platform designed to scale for fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by customer obsession, extreme urgency, excellence and resourcefulness to to power 5,000+ global brands while we head to 100,000+.

  

Driven by the same customer-centric mentality as above, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're a driver and not passenger and are ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.

 **The Opportunity:**

  

Thrive on change and grow beyond limits! We are looking for a bold thinker who sees a chance to learn and define what's possible with every challenge! Ready to make an impact? Welcome to Maropost and you can turn ideas into action!



We are looking for an open-minded and enthusiastic intermediate-level Scala Engineer to join our backend team. We are a passionate and highly collaborative team with a bias for quality and continuous improvement. If you are looking for an environment where you can learn and see your ideas come to life, let's talk!

 **The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET (+/- 2 hours)**.

 **What You'll Be Responsible For:**

  

* Design and write sustainable, easy-to-read, and elegant code, rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed.
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries
* Review feedback on the specs and the code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Make recommendations regarding introducing new tools and improving processes.
* Continuous learning of different programming paradigms and new technologies
* Work with a highly collaborative group of engineers.

  


**What You'll Bring to Maropost:**

  

* 3+ years of experience in **Scala**.
* 2+ years' experience with mapping business domains into **SQL schemas**.
* Experience with **message-based architectures** (we use Pulsar).
* Knowledge in **API design** (REST or GraphQL).
* Understand and work with modern cloud-native infrastructure (we deploy to Kubernetes).
* Responsible for builds and **CI/CD processes** (we use CircleCI for builds and GitOps with ArgoCD for back-end deployments).
* Excellent communication skills, a bias for feedback and continuous improvement, combined with the ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
* The ability to take ownership and initiatives over tasks/projects and share any new ideas with the team.
* You exemplify Maropost’s Values:
	+ Customer Obsessed
	+ Extreme Urgency
	+ Excellence
	+ Resourceful

  

  



**Message from the Founders:** Maropost is looking for builders - people who want to drive our business forward at all costs in order to achieve the goals we have both short and long term for the results and outcomes that that will bring to us all.

  

If that isn't for you that’s ok, for those of you that it is please get in touch with us!

title: Senior Software Engineer (Frontend), Remote
description:
Everything we do is for our customers!

  

Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a unified commerce experience that our customers need, transforming ecommerce, retail, marketing automation, merchandising, helpdesk and AI operations with one platform designed to scale for fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by customer obsession, extreme urgency, excellence and resourcefulness to to power 5,000+ global brands while we head to 100,000+.

  

Driven by the same customer-centric mentality as above, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're a driver and not passenger and are ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.

 **The Opportunity:**

  

Thrive on change and grow beyond limits! We are looking for a bold thinker who sees a chance to learn and define what's possible with every challenge! Ready to make an impact? Welcome to Maropost and you can turn ideas into action!



We are looking for an open minded and enthusiastic mid-level engineer to join our team. If you are interested in developing and maintaining a mature product that millions of people use daily, we would love to meet you! We are a product-driven team, and we’re looking for someone who loves to be engaged in the product development process and appreciates being able to deliver an outcome without depending on other engineers.

 **The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET (+/- 2 hours)**.

 **What you’ll be Responsible for:**

  

* As a software engineer, focusing primarily on the frontend on our team, you'll be working with other engineers to further develop and architect our search and merchandising as a service product.
* On the frontend we have our main backoffice dashboard written in vue.js and we develop and maintain integrations for our customer's ecommerce stores as a react based SDK and, more recently, also packaged natively for specific platforms such as Shopify.
* The TypeScript backend is responsible for several microservices, from managing the product configuration to integration with various platforms. The main database is PostgreSQL, and we also use cool tech such as Apache Pulsar.
* We’re an empowered product team, firmly committed to collaborative problem solving. We write specs and share the decision-making. We work in two-week sprints to deliver greatness.
* Designing and writing maintainable, readable and elegant code and rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Embracing feedback on your specs and your code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries

  


**What You'll Bring to Maropost:**

  

* Have at least 3 years of experience with frontend frameworks/libraries (**VueJS**)
* Have experience with vanilla **TypeScript**, HTML, and CSS. Ability to manipulate the DOM, understand event-driven programming, and build responsive web applications is a strong plus.
* Have some experience with backend javascript frameworks (we use Node/Express and Node/Nest with **TypeScript**)
* Appreciate well-designed APIs and can contribute to their design (REST or GraphQL, we use both)
* Understands modern cloud native infrastructure (we use AWS/GCP)
* Appreciate good developer experience and make ours even better by introducing new tools and iterating on processes
* Are generous with your communication, whether it is about new ideas, praise, or very kindly phrased constructive feedback
* Like to learn new things, have an open mind and want to share your knowledge with your coworkers
* Are an effective technical and non-technical communicator (our company language is English)
* You exemplify Maropost’s Values:
	+ Customer Obsessed
	+ Extreme Urgency
	+ Excellence
	+ Resourceful

  

  



**Message from the Founders:** Maropost is looking for builders - people who want to drive our business forward at all costs in order to achieve the goals we have both short and long term for the results and outcomes that that will bring to us all.

  

If that isn't for you that’s ok, for those of you that it is please get in touch with us!

title: Senior Data Engineer (8+ års erfarenhet)
description:
**Om rollen:**  

Vi söker en erfaren och självgående Senior Data Engineer som vill vara med och bygga framtidens dataplattform. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i vårt datateam och arbeta med moderna molnteknologier för att möjliggöra dataanalys, maskininlärning och datadrivna beslut i hela organisationen.
  
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:**  

Design och implementation av robusta och skalbara datalösningar
  
  

Bygga och underhålla pipelines för dataextraktion, transformering och laddning (ETL/ELT)
  
  

Modellera data och utveckla datalagerlösningar i molnmiljö (t.ex. Azure, AWS eller GCP)
  
  

Säkerställa hög datakvalitet, spårbarhet och tillgänglighet
  
  

Samarbeta med dataanalytiker, datavetare och verksamheten för att förstå behov och skapa värde
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

Minst 8 års relevant erfarenhet inom data engineering
  
  

Goda kunskaper i SQL och programmering (ex. Python eller Scala)
  
  

Erfarenhet av moderna molnplattformar (Azure, AWS eller GCP)
  
  

Vana att arbeta med databashantering, datalager och realtidsdataflöden
  
  

Meriterande med erfarenhet av verktyg som dbt, Airflow, Snowflake eller Databricks
  
  

Förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
  
  

Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
  

**Vi erbjuder:**  

Ett spännande uppdrag i ett snabbväxande och innovativt företag
  
  

Möjlighet att påverka arkitektur och val av teknik
  
  

Flexibla arbetsformer och ett engagerat team
  
  

Konkurrenskraftig ersättning och förmåner
