title: Register your Interest: Enterprise Account Director – Talent Solutions, Nordics
description:
**Company Description**
 LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 Join us to transform the way the world works.
   

  

**Job Description**
 This role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Please note we currently do not have an active opening. By submitting your application, you are registering your interest in potential future openings similar to the below that may arise and which you are happy to be contacted about.
   

  

 At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business.
 *The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.*
 We are looking for an Enterprise Account Director to join our Talent Solutions team, in acting as a trusted adviser and bringing value to our customers, focusing on the business. As a member of our Talent Solutions Sales Team, you will be a part of a group of sales professionals who are bringing LinkedIn’s Talent Solutions products (Hiring and Learning) to the Enterprise Customers.
   

  

 You will be responsible for helping our customers effectively engage with the LinkedIn network using our professional hiring and learning solutions. You will be dedicated to making our customers stronger and seeking out opportunities for growth. Although you possess a strategic approach to selling and strive to meet/exceed revenue goals, you will always have your clients’ best interest in mind and act as their internal advocate to ensure they are set up for success.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Researches Customer’s business and prepares thoughtful questions and insights in advance of customer meetings
* Asks layered, open-ended questions to understand and clarify Customer’s objectives and challenges beyond surface-level detail
* Builds relationships with multiple stakeholders (vertically and horizontally) across the Customer’s organization
* Shifts communication style and content to fit the needs of different stakeholders
* Leads with Solutions, not products, when making recommendations aligned to Customer objectives
* Sells with Integrity
* Drives customer decision making by achieving shared vision and proactively considering the value props that tie all stakeholders together
* Thinks commercially and applies business acumen when crafting & negotiating commercial agreements
* Uses data and insights to support investment recommendations or overcome customer objections
* Proactively mitigates churn risk by adopting a smart, customer-centric approach
* Engages customers throughout to confirm and clarify value and adapts a strategy when needed to optimize ROI
* Drives Customer growth by proactively identifying opportunities to deliver greater customer value
* Applies business acumen in Account Planning by considering economic, industry, and company factors with a Customer-centric lens.
* Maps all key stakeholders in an account to assess the strength of the account relationship and create account outreach strategy
* Agrees to joint accountability with colleagues and cross-functional teams for optimal customer success
* Practices humility and asks for help from colleagues when faced with a challenge or unknown
* Is disciplined in Territory and Account Planning, Forecasting, and Quota Attainment
* Follows best practices when using CRM and other Sales tools in order to manage the Sales and Buyer cycles


**Qualifications**
**Basic Qualifications:**
* 5+ years experience in a closing sales role
* Business fluency in English


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Business fluency in Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, or Finnish
* Experience with HR software
* Experience with SaaS opportunities
* Experience selling IT solutions
* Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions
* Strong negotiation and accurate forecasting skills
* Experience carrying a revenue target with the ability to develop compelling strategies that deliver results
* Excellent communication, negotiation and forecasting skills
* Demonstrated ability to find and manage high-level business in an evangelistic sales environment
* Ability to gather and use data to inform decision making and persuade others
* Ability to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyers
* Ability to orchestrate the closure of business with an accurate understanding of prospect needs
* Ability to include multiple partners and members of the company management team using competitive selling to position company products against direct and indirect competitors


**Suggested Skills:**
* Negotiation and forecasting skills
* Consultative Selling
* Stakeholder Management


**Additional Information**
**Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates**
 Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

title: Graphic Design Assistant
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Graphic Design Assistant at our Stockholm Head Office you will be part of the Graphic & Branding Design team within the Product & Design Department. This is a team that ensures that all products are distinctly recognized as Acne Studios designs through the creation of different graphic expressions, including logo’s, symbols, brand labels, care & composition label, and more. You will support the team throughout all stages of the design and production process and collaborate cross functional within the company.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As Graphic Design Assistant your main contribution will be to assist in the daily operations of the Graphic & Branding Design team from initial research to production stage. You will play a vital role in the design and production process, where precision and pro-active support are essential to succeed in the role. You will contribute to the team by:
   

  

* Providing support in creating artworks and design proposals including mock-ups and photoshops
* Prepare technical packs including graphic placement to launch with suppliers
* Act as a key liaison by gathering and compiling information, and share consolidate updates with cross functional departments
* Maintain and update seasonal overviews, inspiration- and collection boards and branding guidelines
* Organize and manage the team’s SharePoint, ensuring it is accurate, up-to-date, and well-structured
* Ensure balanced communication and collaboration with all cross functional partners


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Pro-active and organized with strong attention for details
* Flexible and have the ability to work in a fast paced environment
* Cooperative team player with a positive mind set


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Academic degree from graphic design
* Minimum of 6 months’ experience in a similar role preferably from a fashion brand
* Strong communication skills in written and spoken English
* Advanced knowledge of Adobe inDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop
* Strong interest in typography and fashion
* Good sketching and illustration skills


 In your application we kindly ask you to submit your portfolio.
   

  

 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: Innovation AI - Intern
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Consulting
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Data Infrastructure and Analytics, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
**Internship – Innovation, Data & Analytics, Artificial Intelligence** 




**Location: Stockholm** 




**Start Date: immediately.** 




**Building greater futures through innovation and collective knowledge** 




  






 Tata Consultancy Services
 

 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



 We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.
 



**We look forward to receiving your application via Neelavani.k@tcs.com** 




  





**Your perspectives and assignments:** 



* Focus on following dimensions (1) Data and Analytics for business, (2) Artificial Intelligence & Automation, (3) Sustainability & Digital Solutions, (4) Research & Innovation themes. It is likely that business use cases exist at the intersection of these themes.
* Study tech and business trends in key themes and industries
* Support the build up of TCS Stockholm Pace Studio (i.e. TCS Innovation Hub). This will involve working with the design team to create new experiences for TCS and Customers.
* Organize innovation events and workshops on identified themes
* Profile Artificial Intelligence Ecosystem in Sweden. Identify potential collaboration partners
* Develop channels with Academic and Research Institutions in Sweden
* Coordinate Innovation, AI and Research initiatives working with Sales, Account, CTO teams
* Work with Sales and Account teams on research and advisory services related to strategy,
* Prepare research papers and business presentations
* Participate in conferences to enhance understanding of AI, Innovation, Sustainability themes



  





**Your Qualifications:** 



* Enrollment in a Bachelor's (at least in the 2nd year) or Master's degree program
* Awarenes (or experience) of Digital Technology and Artificial Intelligence concepts
* Experience in the field of sustainability and or AI/digital tech gained through seminar or project work, internships or extracurricular activities
* Good to have: Project/ Uni experience on digital tech (low-code/ no-code platforms)
* Passion for personal and professional development on Digital Technology and AI
* Strong research and analytical skills
* Networking skills to engage actively with internal and external stakeholders
* Strong proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
* Ability to work in an international working environment.
* Structured and independent way of working
* Business fluent in English and Swedish



  





**Duration of Internship: six to twelve months** 




**We look forward to receiving your application via r.naveen2@tcs.com** 









**Privacy Note:** 




**https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Director – Cyber Security
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Oil and Gas, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role: Director-Cybersecurity** 




**Experience (Years): 13 +** 




  





**Roles & Responsibilities:** 



* Collaborate with the Geo Sales/ Customer to understand the requirements and develop tailored cyber security solutions.
* Conduct thorough assessments of client environments to identify security gaps and recommend appropriate solutions.
* Present and articulate the value proposition of our cyber security products and services to clients and stakeholders.
* Develop and deliver technical presentations, demonstrations, and proof-of-concept engagements to showcase our solutions.
* Act as a trusted advisor to clients, providing insights on industry trends, best practices, and compliance requirements.
* Work closely with the product management and engineering teams to provide feedback on customer needs and product enhancements.
* Participate in the development of sales strategies and contribute to the overall growth of the cyber security business.
* Strong storytelling, consultative solution selling, value proposition, strong articulation and negotiation skills
* Ability to connect with CXOs, drive proactive business, build pipeline, influence decision makers.
* Stay up to date with the latest cyber security threats, technologies, and industry developments to effectively address client concerns.
* Respond to client issued RFQ, RFI, and RFP working with the account team, offshore/onsite pre-sales team, solution architects and SMEs to prepare best in class solutions and estimate the efforts required to deliver the proposed solution.
* Domain knowledge & experience in minimum two or more domains is a MUST
* Primarily in Identity & Access Management, Enterprise Vulnerability Management, MDR/SOC, Cloud Security, OT Security



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Cyber Security or a related field.
* 15+ years of enterprise technology experience, out which at least 6+ years in Cyber security services and products.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CEH, or similar) are a plus
* Willingness to travel and work in a fast-faced result-oriented environment.
* Proven track record in leading complex engagements and managing client relationships at senior levels.



  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Head of Customer Success
description:
Sleip AI AB is a Swedish technology company founded in 2020, specializing in AI-based software for gait analysis in horses using mobile phone cameras. Founded by engineer Axel Nyström and veterinarian and SLU researcher Elin Hernlund, combining scientific expertise, technological innovation, and strong market traction, Sleip AI is today a leading player in veterinary medtech, serving customers in over 50 countries.
   

  

 In early 2024, Sleip AI completed a funding round, securing SEK 43 million in financing. Following the round, the company was valued at just over 250 MSEK. Among the investors are Karl-Johan Persson, as well as the German pharmaceutical company Boehringer Ingelheim which has also entered into a commercial partnership with Sleip.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Sleip AI is now looking for a key individual to help set the foundation and the development of
   

  

 Sleip's customer experience in line with the global expansion.
   

  

 As Head of Customer Success, you will hold responsibility for:
   

  

* Owning and developing the entire customer journey - from onboarding to renewal, loyalty and upsell.
* Identifying and acting on user data - including churn signals, activation points, and conversion flows.
* Leading and growing the Customer Success and Support team.
* Modeling ideal customer behavior - being proactive and building scalable processes.
* Establishing and refining systems for automation, follow-up, and reporting.
* Collaborating closely with the Chief Medical Officer to design and enhance onboarding and customer education, ensuring effective and sustained use of the product.
* Working closely with Head of Marketing and Head of Growth to translate customer insights into conversion-driving activities.
* Report to the COO, being part of the management team, contributing to building a global market leader.


**Specific Requirements For The Role**
* Previously being responsible for (or being part of) setting up a Customer Success team within a SaaS company.
* Proven ability to lead, mentor, and grow Customer Success professionals in a fast-paced, customer-centric international environment.
* Experience integrating and implementing a digital Customer Success function, collaborating closely with IT.
* Strong analytical skills and experience working in a data-driven environment.
* Proven track record of working with KPIs and goal-oriented performance management.
* Experience working closely with customers – through calls, demos, and follow-ups
* Languages: Fluent English is required. Additional languages such as French, Spanish, or German are a plus.
* Experience as part of an executive management team is preferred.
* A passion for horses and animals is advantageous but not required.
* Academic background.


**Personal characteristics**
 We are looking for a confident and grounded leader with strong commercial acumen and a natural ability to connect with people. You combine a customer-first mindset with a goal-oriented and structured approach.
   

  

 You lead with integrity, bring clarity in complexity, and thrive in social settings. Entrepreneurial by nature, you’re hands-on, self-driven, and comfortable taking initiative. Your analytical skillset complements your business sense, enabling sound decisions and long-term value creation.
   

  

**Interested?**
 If this role resonates with your background and ambitions, we would be glad to hear from you. Please submit your CV via the link below no later than August 4. We review applications on a rolling basis. This recruitment is conducted in collaboration with Aldea Executive Search.
   

  

 For questions regarding the position or process, please contact: Lina Wijk at lina.wijk@aldeaexecutivesearch.se or Anna Sörelius Nordberg at anna@sleip.com

title: Lenovo PC Remote Technical Support
description:
**Introduction**
 Become part of a company that has a passionate commitment to development and technology. IBM consist of people from diverse backgrounds who together solve problems for businesses and organizations around the world.
   

  

 We are now looking for a person with an interest in customer service and technology for our Lenovo Support Center. You will join a fantastic team who provide support to consumer and corporate customers as well as to our Field technicians at customer site. This involves troubleshooting over phone/remote takeover, identify hardware and software issues, supply spare parts and technical instructions to clients and onsite technicians.
   

  

 You should have some experience and knowledge of personal computers (hardware and software, self-interest or education).
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
 The technical agent in the support center is responsible to run the client communication via phone or email, entitles the customer for a special service, delivers the problem determination or problem source identification, creates an action plan, keeps the customer updated about problem resolution progress and triggers the appropriate service delivery method (Fix on Phone, Customer Replaceable Unit, Onsite Service).
   

  

**Preferred Education**
 Technical Diploma
   

  

**Non-Technical Tasks**
**Required technical and professional expertise**
*Call Entry, machine identification, entitlement*
*Routing/ escalation to manufacturer if needed*
*Sales involvement if needed*
*Technical pre sales information*
*Damage & refund*
*Handling of client complaints*
*Live chat/ problem determination chat*
*Other client service requests*
*Non call center transaction based information requests*
*Call tracking and monitoring*
*Voice or email client update communication*
**Technical Tasks**
*Standard Resolution Process*
*Problem Determination/ Problem Source Identification*
*Usage of test equipment & remote tools*
*Action plan Creation*
*Problem management*
*Remote Fix/ CRU involvement*
*Depot repair involvement*
*Onsite repair involvement*
**Required Skills**
*Required Professional and Technical Expertise :*
*General IT awareness will be considered as advantage*
*Good MS Office skills*
*Client Focus*
*Team player*
*Good command of spoken and written skills of English language*
*Excellent Swedish*
*Fluent English*
*Good typing skills*
**Preferred Skills**
**Preferred technical and professional experience**
*Previous client handling/facing experience*
*Previous call center experience*

title: System Engineer - IT Security Specialist
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*
 Din roll
   

  

 I den här rollen kommer du ingå i ett team av ingenjörer som arbetar fokuserat med informationssäkerhet, både internt mot våra utvecklingsavdelningar och externt mot kund. Här spelar du en viktig roll i arbetet med att planera informationssäkerhetsarbetet i projektet samt designa säkerhetsarkitekturen för våra system. Du arbetar nära produktutvecklare, systemingenjörer och verifieringsingenjörer.
   

  

 Genom ditt engagemang bidrar du till att utveckla och förbättra våra lösningar inom informationssäkerhet, så att vi effektivt kan hantera nya intrångshot och möta kundernas krav. Rollen präglas av samarbete och laganda, där du blir en värdefull del av ett team som tillsammans stärker verksamheten inom säkerhetsområdet.
   

  

 Dina huvuduppgifter innefattar:
   

  

* Löpande kommunikation med bland annat kunder, projektledare, systemingenjörer, produktledare och utvecklare
* Risk- och sårbarhetsanalys
* Kravnedbrytning och kravanalys
* IT-säkerhetsarkitektur med inriktning mot Cloud-lösningar


 Vi erbjuder en bred uppdragsportfölj och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter – både inom teknik och ledarskap. Här får du en kreativ plattform att växa i, utifrån din egen riktning.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen ser vi gärna att du är målmedveten och motiverad att ständigt ta dig an nya utmaningar för att både utveckla dig själv och bidra till verksamhetens framgång. Du kan arbeta självständigt och ta eget ansvar, samtidigt som du trivs med att samarbeta och bidra i team. Vidare är du välorganiserad och har ett starkt intresse för att fördjupa dig i tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 Det här ser vi gärna att du har med dig:
   

  

* Kandidat/masterutbildning inom datavetenskap, högskole-/civilingenjörsexamen inom datateknik eller liknande, gärna med inriktning mot informationssäkerhet.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom t.ex teknisk kommunikationssäkerhet, riskhantering, systemutveckling, mjukvaruutveckling.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Standarder inom informationssäkerhet som tex ISO/IEC 27000
* IT-säkerhetsutveckling enligt KSF, NIST eller motsvarande standard
* Design av IT-säkerhet för system
* Governance och compliance inom informationssäkerhet
* Penetrationstestning t.ex CEH
* Relevanta certifieringar tex CISSP, CSSLP


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att urvalsarbetet påbörjas efter semestertiderna, men du är varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan nu!

title: IT Security Specialist
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**Join us as an IT Security Specialist**
 This autumn, we are expanding our Network & Security team and are looking for both junior and senior IT Security Specialists to join us at one of our Swedish locations.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an IT Security Specialist at Billerud, you will be part of a growing and dedicated team working to ensure the protection and resilience of our IT infrastructure. Depending on your experience and interests, your responsibilities may include:
   

  

* Performing vulnerability assessments, risk analyses and incident investigations
* Work with our security solutions and data recovery procedures
* Supporting the development and implementation of security policies and procedures
* Monitoring and optimizing security infrastructure
* Make sure agreements are up to date and that licenses follows business needs
* Participating in or leading IT security-related projects
* Acting as a security advisor in IT and business projects
* Support and collaborate Service Managers & SPOC to deliver on business needs.


 You will report to the Manager of IT Network & Security and be based onsite at one of our Swedish units: Gävle, Skärblacka, Frövi, Gruvön, Karlsborg (Kalix) or at our head office in Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

**Overtime, on-call duty and travel in service within Sweden and potentially to north America may occur occasionally.**
 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We welcome applications from both experienced professionals and those early in their careers. To succeed in this role, you should have:
   

  

* A degree in IT security or equivalent experience
* A strong interest in cybersecurity and a proactive mindset
* Good understanding of IT infrastructure and security principles
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English
* A structured, analytical, and collaborative approach to work


**Workplace & conditions**
* This is an onsite position at one of our Swedish locations. Hybrid work is possible in line with our company policy (up to 2 remote days per week or depending on project needs).
* Please note: We do not offer relocation packages and applicants requires a valid Swedish work permit


**Personal qualities**
 Personlity is important for us. To thrive in this role, we believe you have a strong sense for responsibility showcasing in ability to prioritize, take initiatives and ability to keep focus when working both in teams and independently. You enjoy yourself in contexts demanding flexibility since the IT security area is constantly evolving, both in general and within Billerud. Nevertheless, you also understand and prioritize the importance of documentation.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Åke Olsson, Senior Manager Global IT Network & Security at ake.olsson@billerud.com. If you want to know more about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.
   

  

**Due to the holiday season, feedback and communication may take longer than usual during the summer period. We appreciate your patience and understanding.**
 We decline proposals from external recruitment providers.
   

  

**Application information**
**Selection will occur on ongoing basis and the position might be filled during the application period.**
 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Join both a local and a global team of skilled professionals!
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test and reference checks. Final candidate will require a negative alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Security Consultant
description:
We are hiring an OT Security Consultant to support cybersecurity efforts at our Solna manufacturing site. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with IT and OT security, strong communication skills, and a background in working within manufacturing environments.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead and support OT and IT security projects in collaboration with internal and external teams.
* Identify and manage cyber risks in manufacturing operations.
* Ensure compliance with security policies, standards, and procedures.
* Act as the security liaison between InfoSec and local plant/business teams.
* Monitor the threat landscape and recommend risk mitigation strategies.
* Communicate project updates, risks, and issues to stakeholders.
* Continuously seek process improvements and support knowledge sharing.



  





**Required Skills & Experience:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or a related field.
* 7–10 years of IT/OT security experience, ideally in manufacturing.
* Understanding of OT systems, cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), and network technologies.
* Experience implementing and maintaining security controls and risk assessments.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* CCNA or PMP certification.
* Experience working in cross-functional, global teams.
* Strong problem-solving, facilitation, and stakeholder management skills.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
Are you interested in working on exciting challenges within high transaction environments? We are looking for experienced developers who are curious, can take initiative to come up with new creative solutions, and care about ultimately delivering a great product to join our Engagement team!
 



  






 The Role
 




  





 Our Engagement Product Development team in Stockholm is growing and we are now looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join! Engagement at Betsson Group ensure that our customers come back for more and continue to enjoy our products; it’s all about loyalty! We provide a world class customer experience beyond the gameplay, featuring Tournaments, Dynamic personalized campaigns and much more!
 









 You will be part of preparing our journey to containerization, increasing the scalability of our systems while also maintaining their high quality. To accommodate new requirements, we are constantly re-evaluating our systems design and working on exciting new features.
 



  




* You have experience in
 
 C#, .NET, .NET Core
* SQL Server and NoSQL databases
* Unit testing frameworks
* Messaging within a microservice architecture
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines
* Agile development
* Collaboration / knowledge-sharing



  






 Extra awesome
 



* Kafka
* Exposure to a modern frontend framework (e.g. Angular, React)
* Docker containerization
* Domain driven design



  






 What’s in it for you?
 




  





 For the right person, there are many different career paths at Betsson, both if you want to deepen your technical skills or work with management in the future. We strive to do our best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
 



  




* You will be working side by side with some of the most passionate and talented people in the industry
* A friendly and supportive environment characterized by collaboration & knowledge-sharing
* Professional development programs and training's that will help you achieve your goals and grow both technically as well as professionally
* Office in Tallinn City Centre
* Free Parking nearby the office
* Fitness Allowance, Health Insurance, activities, events
* Paid sick leave days
* Hybrid Work Environment
* Home-internet allowance



  







 In addition to all of this, you will be part of the multi-cultural Betsson community enjoying team-building events, our Friday breakfast and bars, our social clubs, parties and other events. There is always something fun to look forward to!
 



  






 Challenge Accepted?
 




 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our tech colleagues are talking about. By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Chief IT, Security Risk Specialist (Cloud Risk)
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you prepared to drive innovation and influence Cloud Risk Management at a leading Nordic bank? Join Danske Bank as a Chief IT, Security Risk Specialist in our Second Line of Defense, where you’ll play a critical role in shaping how we manage and oversee risks related to Cloud platforms and Generative AI systems across the bank’s digital ecosystem.
   

  

 This role requires a balance of analytical skills, strategic foresight, and the ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams and stakeholders to develop a culture of risk awareness and compliance across the organization. This is your chance to play a vital role, guiding Danske Bank on its journey towards enhanced operational safety, stringent compliance standards, and cutting-edge Cloud risk management.
   

  

 The IT, Security, and Data Risk team at Danske Bank operates as part of the second line of defense (2LoD) function, dedicated to ensuring robust IT, security, and data risk management throughout the organization. As a unit in the Non-Financial Risk (NFR) team within Group Risk Management (GRM), our team serves as the oversight body to promote operational alignment and consistency in the application of IT, security and data risk management policies and frameworks within the group's risk tolerance.
   

  

 We collaborate closely with various stakeholders, including technology operations, business units, security, privacy, cloud risk, compliance risk, and third-party risk management teams. This collaboration ensures a unified approach to managing both internal and external risks in a dynamic financial landscape. Our team’s efforts are pivotal in maintaining the bank’s integrity, establishing a strong risk culture, and securing Danske Bank’s position as the customers’ preferred financial partner. By working together, we aim to meet customer expectations, fulfill regulatory requirements, and uphold the highest standards.
   

  

* Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.


 “We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”
   

  

**You will:**
* Provide independent oversight of IT and security risks, with a focus on Cloud technologies
* Evaluate and challenge first-line risk assessments, control designs, and mitigation strategies to ensure effectiveness and compliance
* Engage and collaborate with stakeholders across Technology, Security, Risk, Compliance, Audit, Legal, and Business units to ensure integrated risk management governance and decision-making
* Monitor and assess emerging technology and cybersecurity risks, contributing to scenario planning, risk reporting, and strategic initiatives
* Offer expert insights to support regulatory interactions, thematic reviews, testing activities and internal governance forums
* Lead independent reviews of Cloud initiatives across their lifecycle, offering second-line risk advisory and ensuring effective governance and control implementation
* Oversee the design, implementation, and effectiveness of Cloud controls, providing independent risk opinions and recommending appropriate mitigation measures
* Promote a culture of risk awareness and compliance across the organization through engagement, education, and strategic alignment
* Stay informed on evolving regulatory requirements and industry standards, particularly those impacting cloud technologies, and assess their implications for the organization


**About you:**
* A minimum of 7 years of experience in IT and security roles, preferably within a second line of defense (2LoD) function or a comparable role with deep exposure to risk oversight and governance (of which 2 years of proven experience with hands-on application of cloud risk assessment and control frameworks)
* A university degree or equivalent qualification in technology-related fields
* Solid experience in IT risk management, cybersecurity, or technology governance—ideally within regulated industries such as financial services—with the ability to influence and advise on complex projects or strategic initiatives. (Note: This is a specialist role without HR responsibilities.)
* Strong understanding of Cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure), systems architecture, and security principles, with the ability to assess associated risks
* Experience with Cloud technologies shared responsibility model and their risk implications for various cloud solutions and cloud deployment models (e.g. SaaS, PaaS, IaaS)
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and industry-standard frameworks such as DORA, Executive Order on Management and Control of Banks, EBA Guidelines, ISF Standard of Good Practice for Information Security (SoGP), COBIT and Cloud specific regulations
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments and influence stakeholders at all levels
* Relevant professional certifications such as CRISC, CISA, CISM, CCSP, and AWS/ Azure certifications (would be beneficial)
* Advanced English language skills


**We offer:**
**This position can be located in Lithuania, Denmark, Poland, Finland and Sweden.**
**If the position is located in Lithuania, the salary range will be from 4080 to 6120 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant to the job).**
 Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:
   

  

* Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
* Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
* Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
* Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
* Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


**See all the benefits** 
**HERE** 
**.**
 "Join a forward-thinking team where we champion excellence in IT, security, and data risk management. As a leader deeply invested in innovation and strategic impact, I empower individuals to thrive, collaborate, and shape the future of risk resilience."
   

  

 We will ensure that the salary offered to you will be based on your qualifications, competencies, professional experience, and requirements for the corresponding job function.
   

  

 Your title in job contract will be Specialist – Risk, Chief.
   

  

 If you have any questions or need further information about this exciting opportunity, please do not hesitate to contact:
 **Rudragouda Patil | LinkedIn** 
**.**
**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: IT/OT Consultant | Operational Technology Security Consultant
description:
