title: Azure Infrastructure Specialist
description:
**Job description**
-------------------


*At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!*

  


**We are now looking for an experienced Azure Infrastructure Specialist with experience in building and operating Azure infrastructure platform**

  

Billerud's IT organization is expanding and in this new role, you will have the main responsibility for building and operating the infrastructure on a globally available, high-performance and secure Azure platform. You'll use your expertise to manage GitOps/DevOps, networks and resources and PaaS environments. Your role involves collaborating with the security team to manage Azure security and building and driving monitoring and visibility for both platform and applications.  

  

  

  



**In this role, you are responsible for:**


* Build and run repos and pipelines for GitOps/DevOps
* Build and run networks and resources
* Management of PaaS environments
* Management of Azure platform through GitOps/DevOps
* Management of Azure security together with Security Team
* Build and run monitoring and observability (both platform and application)
* Support and coach Internal Staff learning above areas

  



You will report to the Manager of IT Network & Security and be based onsite at one of our Swedish units: Gävle, Skärblacka, Frövi, Gruvön, Karlsborg (Kalix) or at our head office in Solna, Stockholm.

  


**Overtime, on-call duty and travel in service within Sweden and potentially to north America may occur occasionally.**

  


*At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative* *here**.*


**Qualifications**
------------------



To succeed in the role of **Azure Specialist**, we believe you have relevant academic education, or equivalent experience and preferably good experience in building and drive an Azure platform. In summary we see that you have solid experience in all, or most, of the below areas:

  


* Azure platform, network & polices management
* Azure DevOps for GitOps Management & PaaS services management
* Infrastructure as code with Bicep
* Secure development lifecycle experience
* Knowledge in Powershell scripting
* We support Billerud globally and fluency in both English and Swedish is important.

  


**Workplace & conditions**


* This is an onsite position at one of our Swedish locations. Hybrid work is possible in line with our company policy (up to 2 remote days per week or depending on project needs).
* Please note: We do not offer relocation packages and applicants requires a valid Swedish work permit


**Personal qualities**
----------------------



We value your personality highly. To thrive in this role, you should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, along with a curiosity for both new and familiar challenges. You enjoy working independently as well as in teams, and you communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues. Since we support Billerud globally, fluency in both English and Swedish is important. You stay up to date with new technologies and industry trends, and you actively contribute to a positive work environment.

  

*Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.*

  


**Contact**
-----------



If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Åke Olsson, Senior Manager Global IT Network & Security at ake.olsson@billerud.com. If you want to know more about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.

  


**Due to the holiday season, feedback and communication may take longer than usual during the summer period. We appreciate your patience and understanding.**

  



We decline proposals from external recruitment providers.


**Application information**
---------------------------

  

**Please submit your application by August 10th. Selection will occur after final application date.**

  

Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

  

  

**Why us?**


* Join both a local and a global team of skilled professionals!
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.

  


**Our recruitment process** will include interviews, recruitment test and reference checks. Final candidate will require a negative alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.

title: SAP Release Manager
description:
**Job description**
-------------------


*At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!*

  


**Become a key player in Billerud's SAP Transformation journey as a Release Manager**

  



We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Release Manager to join our IT team, with a strong focus on managing releases within our SAP S/4HANA landscape.

  

This is a new role at Billerud. The final candidate will have the responsibility to create, transform and implement release management processes from the ground up, ideally drawing on prior experience from greenfield SAP implementations, as well as establish relevant forums in order to meet business needs.

  



As the release manager you will be responsible for planning, coordinating and overseeing the delivery of changes and new functionalities across our SAP S/4HANA systems and integrated platforms. You will work closely with Process Workstreams in the transformation program, our newly created SAP maintenance team, as well as development teams, Operations, and business stakeholders to ensure high-quality and timely deployments in a complex enterprise environment.

  

**In this role you will be responsible for:**

  



Release and Change Management


* Coordinate release planning and execution across SAP and SAP-connected systems. Examples of components (S/4Hana (L2C, F2P,S2P, A2D, F2C), Ariba, IBP, BTP etc)
* Prioritize and allocate resources effectively to meet deadlines and resolve conflicts during release cycles.
* Create, maintain and communicate a global release calendar to minimize business disruption.
* Serve as the central liaison for coordinating releases with SAP RISE operations, third-party AMS providers and internal development teams.
* Define and implement standardized release governance processes.
* Oversee release cutover planning, dry-runs, validation, and post-deployment support readiness.

  



Process Development & Improvement


* Track and report on release health metrics.
* Ensure traceability and documentation in SAP Solution Manager, ITSM System and JIRA.

  


You will be based at any of our sites in Sweden such as Gävle, Gruvön, Frövi, Skärblacka, Karlsborg or Stockholm, Solna.

  



Travels to our headquarters in Solna will occur and travels to North America may be required to support Release process and project activities.

  


**We don’t offer relocation packages, and a Swedish work permit is requested for this position.**

  


*At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative* *here**.*


**Qualifications**
------------------


**To succeed in the role of IT Release Manager, we believe you have:**


* Documented IT education at university level or equivalent.
* Documented IT education at university level or equivalent.
* Experience in designing and implementing release management processes in greenfield SAP S/4HANA environments.
* Extensive experience in IT project management, or SAP administration, with experience focused on managing SAP landscapes, SAP Solution Manager and ITIL processes.
* Experience working with cloud environments and coordinating with third-party AMS vendors.
* Practical understanding of DevOps and agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe).

  


**Preferred certifications:**


* ITIL Foundation or Advanced Certification.
* SAP certifications in relevant modules (e.g., SAP S/4HANA, SAP Cloud Platform).
* Cloud certifications (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) optional.

  


**We don’t offer relocation packages and a Swedish work permit is requested for this position.**


**Personal qualities**
----------------------



We place great emphasis on your personality. The ideal candidate is a proactive and solution-oriented team player who thrives in environments where structures and processes are not yet fully established. You enjoy taking ownership and building ways of working from the ground up and you are motivated by the opportunity to shape and implement release management processes in a greenfield SAP landscape.

  



You are innovative and unafraid to try new approaches, with a natural ability to connect people and act as the “spider in the web” across teams and stakeholders. Strong leadership and coordination skills are essential for orchestrating complex global release cycles across multiple systems and teams. You are structured, strategic and comfortable navigating ambiguity and shifting priorities.

  

*Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.*


**Contact**
-----------



 If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Ann Josefsson, Senior Director Global IT Applications, at Ann.Josefsson@billerud.com. For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.

  



We kindly decline offers from external recruitment providers.


**Application information**
---------------------------


**Welcome with your application no later than August 10th.**

  



Selection will take place after the application deadline. Due to the holiday season, feedback and communication may take longer than usual during the summer period.

  

  

Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

  

  

**Why us?**


* Join both a local and global team of skilled professionals!An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.

  


**Our recruitment process** will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as a background check.

title: Enterprise Account Executive Northern Europe (Remote UKI/Netherlands/Nordics)
description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500+ integrations and fair-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.


We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


* We’re a diverse team of + 120 talented people
* Our annual recurring revenue is growing over 7x year-over-year
* ️ With +117k GitHub stars, we are in the top 100 most popular projects of all time on Github
* We were the 25th fastest growing startup last year and 4th BtoB SaaS Rising 100 this year in Europe according to Sifted
* We were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our $60M Series B (February '25, led by Highland)


We are looking for a driven Enterprise Account Executive with a strong entrepreneurial mindset to reinforce our team of 8 AEs selling our Enterprise plans [https://n8n.io/pricing/?selfHosted=true] and planned to focus more on the Northern European market.
  

You will be reporting to Neye, our Head of Sales Europe, and collaborating closely with our SDRs, Solutions Engineers, and Customer Success Managers.


* **SALES CYCLE:** You’ll own the full sales cycle (5-7 months on average) from opportunity detection to drafting compelling offers.
* **INBOUND (70-80%):** You drive and optimize the pipeline of inbound, product-qualified leads for n8n's self-hosted Enterprise plans (Company size: over 500 employees | Land deal size: 50-300K ARR).
* **OUTBOUND (20-30%):** You relentlessly test out innovative outbound strategies to build a sustainable leads pipeline.
* **STRATEGIC RELATIONSHIPS:** You develop and cultivate relationships with key decision-makers, particularly team leaders in DevOps, engineering, and IT. Be the trusted advisor our clients turn to for workflow automation solutions.
* **SALES EFFICIENCY:** Be proactive in developing and improving sales processes, infrastructure and collateral.
* **PRODUCT IMPROVEMENT:** Work closely with our product team, ensuring a seamless flow of customer feedback.

**Key success factors:**

* +800 inbound leads per month
* Support from solution consultants and the product team
* Strong community: around 50% inbound leads are already product qualified

**Requirements**
----------------

* **6+ years of sales experience at a BtoB SaaS company, including at least 2 years of complex Enterprise sales.**
* **Enterprise experience:** You’re used to closing 5-6 figure deals.
* **Top performer:** You’ve been in the top 10% performers in your team.
* **High quota:** You've held a +800K ARR quota in your current / previous roles.
* **Highly tech-savvy:** You’ve sold to highly technical stakeholders (IT operations, devops, secops, software engineers) and/or know how to code and/or have an engineering background.
* **Entrepreneurial mindset:** You spot opportunities for growth, suggest a plan to address them, and execute it. You’re able to work independently without a ton of established structure or processes.
* **Hunter mindset:** You have a proven track record in outbound sales.
* **Bonus points:** You have experience with open source, developer tools, PLG companies and/or startups at Series A/B stage. You have sold to IT Operations, cybersecurity teams and leaders.
* **Language:** Native in English, with additionally either French, Spanish, or Italian.
* **Location:** Based in territory (UK, Ireland, Netherlands, Nordics).

*n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

*We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.*

***Our company language is English.***

*You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our* *Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n* *(**https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35**).*

***Location disclaimer:*** *If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.*

**Benefits**
------------

* **Competitive compensation** – We offer fair and attractive pay.
* **Ownership** – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
* **Work/life balance** – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:


	+ **Europe:** 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
	+ **US:** 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
* **Health & wellness** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
* **Future planning** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** 401(k) retirement plan.
* **Financial security** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
* **Career growth** – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
* **A passionate team** – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
* **Remote-first** – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
* **Giving back** – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
* **Transparency** – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
* **An ambitious but kind culture** – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
* *Country-specific details are provided in your contract.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
### **Join Trialbee as a DevOps Engineer – Power the platform that connects patients to lifesaving clinical trials!**

At **Trialbee**, we’re not just deploying software—we’re helping bring life-changing treatments to patients by making clinical trials more accessible and inclusive. As a **DevOps Engineer**, you'll play a critical role in scaling, securing, and optimizing the cloud infrastructure behind our patient recruitment platform.


This isn’t just infrastructure—it’s impact. If you're excited about automation, uptime, and making a real difference in healthcare, this is the opportunity for you.

### **What you will do:**

* Architect and maintain scalable infrastructure on **AWS**
* Build smart, secure **CI/CD pipelines** with GitHub Actions
* Ensure our platform delivers **99.9%+ uptime** with built-in security and compliance
* Implement **monitoring and observability** systems with tools like Prometheus and Grafana
* Support zero-downtime deployments, secure data practices, and best-in-class performance
* Collaborate closely with dev teams to streamline releases, solve problems, and continuously improve developer experience
* Help ensure compliance with **HIPAA, GDPR, and ISO 27001**, keeping patient data safe and trusted

### **Why join Trialbee:**

* Be part of a purpose-driven team using technology to transform healthcare
* Work with a curious, humble, kind, and fun crew who love solving hard problems
* Build automation and tools that reduce friction and increase velocity across the company
* Learn and grow in an environment that values quality, collaboration, and initiative

### 

### **Who we are looking for:**


You don’t need to know everything, but you should be passionate about cloud-native tech and eager to work across:

* **AWS services** (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, IAM, VPC, and more)
* **Infrastructure-as-Code** (Terraform, Ansible)
* **CI/CD pipelines** (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, GitLab)
* **Containers & orchestration** (Docker, Kubernetes)
* **Monitoring & observability** (Grafana, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry)
* **Automation & scripting** (Bash, Python)

  

Bonus: DevOps/Cloud Certifications, ISO 27001 knowledge, or healthcare tech experience


You’ll also thrive here if you’re proactive, security-conscious, and excited by **continuous improvement** in a regulated, mission-critical environment.

**Location:** This is a hybrid position, which requires you to be in the office three times a week, in Malmö.

 **Ready to do meaningful work that matters? Apply now and join us in making clinical research more accessible for patients around the world!**

title: Senior ProServe Cloud Architect, Professional Services
description:
DESCRIPTION


The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking an experienced ProServe Cloud Architect (PCA) to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to understand their technical requirements and business objectives, designing and implementing tailored cloud solutions. You'll be a key player in the pre-sales process, providing technical expertise and guidance throughout the customer's cloud journey.  

  

In this role, you'll be responsible for creating and leading the solution design to address customer business outcomes (CBO). Operating as the conduit between ProServe Account Executives and our Shared Delivery Teams (SDT), you’ll ensure proposed solutions are realistic, achievable, and optimize ProServe and/or our partners to maximize CBOs. As a PCA you are a trusted advisor to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to address customer challenges. As a technical SME, you will share knowledge within the organization, through mentoring, training, creation of reusable artifacts and process improvements.  

  

Your experience in designing technical solutions within the technology/consulting sector, will equip you with the ability to architect complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer, translating technical concepts into business value. Your success as a PCA will be linked to impacting the signing of SOWs, and the successful implementation of solutions which achieve CBOs while exceeding customer satisfaction (CSAT) expectations.
  

  

The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.  

  

Eligibility requirement:  

* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language

  

Key job responsibilities  

As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
  

* Designing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions to deliver customer business outcomes (CBOs)
* Providing technical guidance and best practices during pre-sales and implementation phases
* Collaborating with Account Managers and Shared Delivery Teams to ensure proposed solutions are realistic and achievable
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts

  

A day in the life  

AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.  

  

  

  

  

About the team  

Diverse Experiences:
  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture
  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon
  

conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth
  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

  

Work/Life Balance
  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience in cloud architecture, including designing and implementing cloud solutions.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Hands-on programming/scripting experience to drive the design, development and deployment of business software infrastructure at scale

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Advanced technology degree or AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Deep understanding of AWS services across compute, storage, networking, security, databases, machine learning, and serverless technologies
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Expertise in performance optimization and cost management for cloud environments
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences as part of pre-sales motion

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
  
Job details


SWE, Stockholm


Solutions Architect
company_addresses: 440 Terry Ave N, Seattle, WA, United States, Washington
company_description: Our mission is to be Earth's most customer-centric company.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
DESCRIPTION


As a Solutions Architect at AWS, you’ll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.
  

  

You’ll manage the overall technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their challenging projects. Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features. In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to implement cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.
  

  

You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).  

  

If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible, come build the future with us.  

  

This role is within the Sweden organization and you would be working with Enterprise customers.  

  

Come build the future with us.  

  

AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

  

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS


Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).  

Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures  

Bachelor's degree, HAVO diploma or equivalent  

Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries  

Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud  

Experience with AWS technologies  

Cloud Technology Certification (such as Solutions Architecture, Cloud Security Professional or Cloud DevOps Engineering)

description:
**Role: Cloud Engineer** 




**Duration: 4 months + chance of extensions** 




**Location: Stockholm (Hybrid Working)** 




**Pay Rate: Negotiable** 




**Language: English Speaking Accepted** 




  





**Job Role:** 




  




* We are looking for a Cloud Platform Engineer with hands-on experience in GCP infrastructure and platform engineering to join our client’s central cloud platform team. The team is responsible for building and maintaining the GCP landing zone, governance frameworks, and central services that enable product teams to securely and efficiently deploy applications and analytics in the cloud.
* This role requires deep knowledge of GCP architecture and components (e.g., IAM, networking, logging, monitoring), proficiency in Terraform, and a track record of automating infrastructure and enabling self-service capabilities. You’ll work on foundational elements like Shared VPCs, Workload Identity Federation (WIF), and centralized policy enforcement, as well as collaborate with product teams to provide best practices and architectural support.



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Enhance and maintain the
 **GCP landing zone** 
 , including governance, networking, and security frameworks
* Design, build, and manage
 **central platform services** 
 (e.g., BigQuery quota control, WIF, PAM integrations)
* Implement and improve
 **automation and self-service capabilities** 
 across the platform
* Provide architectural guidance and support to product and analytics teams on GCP services (e.g., IAM, VPC, Cloud Run, Vertex AI)
* Contribute to defining and enforcing best practices around infrastructure, security, observability, and cost optimization
* Collaborate with stakeholders such as Security, DevOps, and Application Teams to ensure compliance and scalability of cloud solutions



  





**Required Qualifications:** 



* 3+ years of
 **hands-on experience with GCP** 
 , particularly in platform engineering and infrastructure architecture
* Proven experience with
 **Terraform** 
 and infrastructure-as-code practices
* Deep understanding of
 **GCP services** 
 such as IAM, VPC, Cloud Monitoring, BigQuery, and Cloud Run
* Experience in managing
 **Shared VPC** 
 , setting up
 **Workload Identity Federation (WIF)** 
 , and developing central platform policies
* Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar)
* Experience working in large-scale environments with a
 **platform team or cloud center of excellence**
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Experience with
 **policy-as-code frameworks** 
 (e.g., OPA/Constraint Templates)
* Familiarity with
 **Vertex AI** 
 or
 **GCP-native ML/analytics workflows**



  





**Must Have Skills:** 



* **GCP (Google Cloud Platform)**
* **Terraform**

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
Vill du bygga digitala tjänster som faktiskt gör skillnad på riktigt? Hos oss på Gofido är tech motorn i ett bolag som utmanar hela försäkringsbranschen. Vi söker nu en Fullstackutvecklare som vill vara med och forma framtidens försäkringsplattform tillsammans med ett erfaret team.
 




  






 Här får du vara med där det händer samtidigt som du bidrar till att skapa enklare, smartare och tryggare försäkringslösningar för tusentals människor.
 




  





**Hos oss får du:** 



* En nyckelroll i ett bolag där teknik är centralt för affären
* Flexibelt hybridarbete och moderna kontor
* Konkurrenskraftig lön som speglar din erfarenhet
* Ett meningsfullt uppdrag där din kod påverkar människors vardag och trygghet



  





**Rollen & Teamet** 





 Du kommer att arbeta i ett agilt team med erfarna kollegor inom olika områden. Tillsammans utvecklar ni både interna system och kundnära lösningar. Du har stort inflytande över tekniska beslut, arkitektur och arbetssätt.
 




  






 Vi jobbar snabbrörligt med hög kvalitet samtidigt som vi har roligt på vägen. Här får du både utrymme att vara tekniskt djup och bred, samtidigt som du är med och formar processer, plattform och produkt.
 




  





**Tech-stack:** 



* Backend: Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL
* Frontend: React, Next.js, TypeScript
* DevOps & Hosting: GCP (Google Cloud Platform), Cloud Run, CI/CD
* Övrigt: REST APIs, Microservicesarkitektur, Eventhantering, Git, Jira



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* 5+ års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Java och Spring Boot
* Vana att bygga moderna gränssnitt med React och Next.js
* God förståelse för TypeScript och komponentbaserad arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av relationsdatabaser, särskilt PostgreSQL
* Tidigare arbete i molnmiljöer, gärna GCP
* Intresse för kodkvalitet, testbarhet och DevOps-principer



  





**Det är ett extra plus om du har:** 



* Erfarenhet från försäkring eller annan reglerad bransch
* Erfarenhet av arkitektur och tekniskt ledarskap



  






 Rekryteringen sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan!

title: Test Lead
description:
*På Implema får du möjlighet att både utveckla dig själv och våra erbjudanden samtidigt som du blir en del av en fantastisk intern kultur och gemenskap. Med över 20 års erfarenhet hjälper vi svenska och internationella företag att skapa effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser. Vi har kontor på 10 orter i Sverige, 300 medarbetare, och omsätter 500 MSEK.*
 Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och skapa något nytt. Hos oss får du en central roll i att forma både affären och kulturen i ett växande team. Du blir en viktig del av Implema Business Solutions – vårt nya affärsområde som driver transformation på riktigt.
   

  

 SAP-transformationer är mer än teknik. Det är en affärsresa som kräver en partner som förstår förändring. Implema leder komplexa SAP-program – med expertis i nyckelområden som projektledning, arkitektur och förändringsledning. Vi maximerar affärsvärdet och levererar hela vägen in i mål. Vill du driva riktig transformation? Vi vet hur man gör.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker dig som vill hjälpa våra kunder leda testarbete i några av marknadens mest spännande SAP-transformationer. Som testledare hos oss kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att säkerställa hög kvalitet i de lösningar vi levererar kund. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder för att planera, genomföra och följa upp tester i olika projekt.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**
* Leda och koordinera testaktiviteter i olika kundprojekt.
* Skapa och implementera teststrategier och testplaner.
* Säkerställa att testkrav uppfylls och kvaliteten på leveranserna är hög.
* Kommunicera med både interna och externa intressenter om teststatus och resultat.
* Genomföra och dokumentera testning samt hantera felrapporter och avvikelser.
* Stödja och coacha testare i deras arbete.


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av testledning.
* God förståelse av SAP affärssystem.
* God erfarenhet av att arbeta med testverktyg och gärna erfarenhet av automatisering.
* Stark förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.
* Förmåga att leda och motivera ett team samt hantera flera parallella projekt.
* Har en konsultativ approach och brinner för leverera kvalité hos kund.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Mediterande:** 
 Certifikation i Test.
   

  

 Vad vi erbjuder?
   

  

 Vi tror på ett arbetsklimat där kunskap delas, initiativ uppmuntras och varje medarbetare får utvecklas – både professionellt och personligt. Med höga ambitioner och högt i tak skapar vi en miljö där det är lätt att trivas. För oss är det viktigt med work-life-balance, och vi värnar om en trygg arbetsmiljö där du mår bra och känner dig sedd.
   

  

**Marknadsmässiga villkor och förmåner som stödjer dig**
 Utöver konkurrenskraftig lön erbjuder vi en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell, trygga pensions- och försäkringslösningar samt friskvårdsbidrag. Dessutom bjuder vi in på sociala aktiviteter som after work, kickoff och konferensresor.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt! Vi rekryterar löpande.
   

  

 #SAP #TestLeader #QualityAssurance #QA #SAPTransformation #SAPImplementation #SAPTesting #TestManagement #TestStrategy #TestPlanning #TestExecution #DefectManagement #TestAutomation #BusinessProcess #EnterpriseResourcePlanning #ERP
   

  

 Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige och omsätter 500 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Architecture and Planning, Construction, and Civil Engineering
description:
**Introduktion**
 WSP Digital Solutions fortsätter att växa, och vi söker nu fler engagerade kollegor till vårt team inom Data Engineering & Analytics. Hos oss får du ett utvecklande, lärorikt och utmanande, men troligen fantastiskt roligt och givande jobb för dig som trivs i ett socialt sammanhang och med kollegor som brinner för teknik, precis som du! Du kommer till en avdelning som har hög trivsel och där vi alltid hjälps åt och är måna om varandra.
   

  

 På vår avdelning arbetar specialister inom bland annat projektledning, rådgivning, BIM, GIS, FME och data engineering. Tillsammans driver vi digitaliseringen av samhällsbyggnadsbranschen framåt.
   

  

**Ansvarsområde**
 Som Data Engineer hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent team med fokus på att skapa digitala lösningar som gör verklig skillnad – främst inom transport- och infrastrukturprojekt. Du kommer att arbeta med utveckling i Microsofts plattform, med särskilt fokus på Azure, datalager och analys.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har ett strukturerat arbetssätt, ett starkt intresse för innovation och effektivisering, samt en vilja att arbeta nära våra kunder i rollen som konsult. Eftersom vi profilerar oss med att ha kunskap både inom utveckling och samhällsbyggnadsbranschen ser vi gärna att du även har kunskap inom de båda områdena.
   

  

 Som person trivs du med att arbeta strukturerat och med fokus på innovation och effektivisering av interna processer. Vi ser att du har ett stort intresse för affärsutveckling och för att aktivt arbeta nära våra kunder som konsult.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Högskoleexamen inom geografisk IT, samhällsbyggnad, civilingenjör, transport, geoinformatik eller liknande.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom data och analys, exempelvis dataintegrationer, datalager, ETL/ELT-flöden eller analysplattformar.
* Erfarenhet av design och arkitektur inom data & analys, inklusive datamodellering och lösningsdesign.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Microsofts lösningar, såsom SQL Server, Azure, Power BI, SSAS m.fl.


 uppdrag där konsult har arbetat i organisation som hanterar/ planerar Trafik av något slag, tex inom, Buss, taxi, båt, flyg, tåg eller liknande.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha arbetat några år inom området på konsultbasis inom samhällsbyggnad. Troligen arbetar du idag i en liknande befattning och är redo för en ny utmaning.
   

  

**Obligatoriska**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom data engineering och/eller analytics.
* Högskoleutbildning inom GIS, samhällsbyggnad, byggteknik eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av programmering i Python.
* Goda kunskaper i SQL och SQL Server.
* Erfarenhet av ETL-utveckling och datamodellering.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgarskap


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Azure-miljö.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla BI-lösningar.
* Kunskap om Python-bibliotek som pandas, numpy, requests och scikit-learn.
* Erfarenhet av integrationsverktyg som dbt och FME.
* Erfarenhet av maskininlärning och AI.


**Kontakt**
 Rekryterande chef: Linnea Mäepea Nilsson, linnea.nilsson@wsp.com
   

  

 HR-Rekrytering: Therese Galvez, therese.galvez@wsp.com
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag**
 Urval sker löpande men vi vill senast få in din ansökan 2025-09-01
   

  

**OBS: Vi kikar på din ansökan så snart vi får möjlighet, men pga sommarsemester kan återkopplingen dröja**
 Kontakt från rekryteringsföretag, CV- och annonssäljare undanbedes.
   

  

**OM WSP I SVERIGE**
 WSP är en av världens ledande teknikkonsulter. Med en enastående bredd av ingenjörer, rådgivare och forskare förenas våra globala talanger för att utveckla lokala lösningar.
   

  

 WSP är verksamma i över 50 länder och har cirka 73 000 medarbetare, eller som vi säger Visionärer. På WSP i Sverige jobbar cirka 3 800 konsulter med att leverera innovativa projekt inom transport, infrastruktur, byggnation, miljö, projektledning, strategisk rådgivning och energi.
   

  

 Följ oss gärna på WSP Sverige (LinkedIn), WSP Sverige (Facebook), eller @wspsweden (Instagram) för en närmare inblick i vår verksamhet samt hur en dag i arbetet kan se ut för våra medarbetare.

title: Technical Lead: Commerce Platform (Node.js)
description:
*This position is 100% remote.
   

  

 Apply here for a better experience: https://www.cobbleweb.co.uk/jobs/technical-lead-sharewise/*
**What are we looking for?**
 CobbleWeb, a leader in online marketplace development, is looking for an exceptional technical lead for our
 **multi-vendor commerce platform** 
 – ShareWise.
   

  

 ShareWise is a React/Node-based library of modular components that can be combined in plug-and-play fashion to build high-growth marketplaces. Its component-based architecture and open-source license make it highly customisable and scalable, setting it apart from template-based ecommerce platforms like Adobe Commerce (previously Magento), CS-Cart, or Shopify.
   

  

 Help us democratise access to the world’s fastest-growing business model by executing our ShareWise vision: a budget-friendly, highly-flexible, and
 **commercially-proven** 
 platform for validating and scaling marketplace startups.
   

  

**Why you should join our team:** 
 Small Companies with Big Impact
   

  

**Who You Are**
**You are a leader who can:**
* Provide strong technical direction.
* Resolve technical bottlenecks.
* Oversee the technical quality of deliverables.


**You Are a Software Development Expert Who Applies**
* Appropriate software engineering practices (e.g. automated testing).
* Continuous improvements to minimise technical debt.
* Agile adaptation to changing business goals and challenges.


**You Are a Technical Specialist Who Has**
* Strong system design skills.
* Deep understanding of platform and modular architecture.
* Advanced collaborative skills: internal & external stakeholders.
* Proven track record of building modular frameworks with high adoption rates.


**Areas Of Responsibility**
* Support purpose-driven development by designing technical solutions that are aligned with the application’s business model and use cases.
* Create, re-evaluate and constantly refine a technical vision that is aligned with the product goals.
* Build and nurture a collaborative team feedback culture to ensure optimal outcomes.
* Create buy-in and alignment among the team with regards to both technical vision as well as granular choices in order to drive efficiencies.
* Take the lead in planning, compiling and maintaining technical documentation (internal and external)
* Ensure a high-performance, scalable and maintainable platform by choosing the right technical architecture, data model and framework.
* Apply best practices – avoid reinventing the wheel and make decisions based on impact.
* Drive Agile methodologies in the team to produce outstanding results.
* Own the quality control process – promote user satisfaction, drive code quality, and push product excellence.


**Job Requirements**
* Proven track record of applying design thinking to platform architecture.
* 2+ years relevant software engineering experience: building commercially successful frameworks with significant traction.
* 5+ years advanced software engineering experience in any competitive product vertical.
* 3+ years in an Agile environment that utilised Behaviour Driven Development, Test Driven Development, Event Driven Architecture, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
* 2+ years experience in a software development leadership role.
* Recommended: exposure to commerce platform development, in particular, online marketplaces.


**Engineering Skills**
* Expert with NodeJS (5+ years experience).
* Expert with various NodeJS frameworks – e.g. Express, Nest, Fastify (5+ years experience).
* Expert with MySQL, PostgreSQL and MongoDB (3+ years experience).
* Some developing experience with ReactJS (2+ years experience).
* Strong understanding of frontend frameworks like NextJS and Headless UI Frameworks such as ShadCN, Radix, etc.
* Experience of REST APIs / GraphQL.
* Use of Docker/Terraform in local and production environments.
* Experience with test automation.
* Experience with integration of third-party applications like Stripe, RabbitMQ, Redis, AWS or Elasticsearch is a plus.

title: Quant Engineer - Sports Betting AI
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
**About Tzeract**
 Welcome to Tzeract! We’re a startup of 20+ engineers within Kambi Group, revolutionizing sports betting with AI, advanced analytics and real-time data. Our small, hybrid, agile team is creating innovative technology that powers next-generation betting experiences. With the backing of Kambi’s global resources, we’ll offer the opportunity to work on complex mathematical projects that scale across international markets. Get to know us better at www.tzeract.com.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 Do you get excited about math and statistics? In this role, you’ll be key to refining the models that drive our AI-powered odds compiling. Your work will involve using machine learning and simulations to analyze sports data. You’ll also contribute to creating reliable, well-structured code and ensuring systems are optimized for performance.
   

  

 Do you have to be a sports fanatic? Of course not. As part of a team that collaborates closely with data engineers and scientists, you’ll apply your mathematical expertise to enhance algorithms and share ideas for improvements. This role offers a mix of support and autonomy, requiring curiosity and initiative to solve complex problems.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Collaborate with the engineering team to integrate algorithms into our production systems, ensuring they operate efficiently at scale.
* Design, develop, and implement advanced mathematical models and machine learning algorithms for predictive analytics in sports betting.
* Conduct statistical analysis to understand data patterns, validate models, and enhance accuracy.
* Work with large-scale, real-time, and historical sports data sets, applying quantitative techniques to extract actionable insights.
* Communicate complex quantitative analyses and concepts to non-technical team members to inform strategy decisions.


**What we believe you have:**
* Master's in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
* Experience in mathematical/statistical modeling and machine learning.
* Proficiency in Python, with experience in libraries like NumPy and Pandas.
* Familiarity with TensorFlow, PyTorch, SciPy, or similar machine learning frameworks.
* Ability to describe reality through mathematics and implement solutions into practical applications.
* Able to multitask different roles-whether it's tackling complex math problems or contributing to development tasks.


**It’s a plus if you have any of the following:**
* PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
* Open-source projects in ML or simulation, especially if relevant to the role's focus areas.
* Familiarity with databases.


**Note** 
 . This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden. We do not support relocation packages.
   

  

**Note 2** 
 . Due to summer vacation you can expect delays in the process and responses.
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Developer 3DExperience, CAD/vPDM for Scania IT
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Do you thrive in an outgoing and friendly atmosphere, are you unpretentious and happy to share your skills with your colleagues? Then this may be the PERFECT opportunity for you!
   

  

**What To Expect**
 You will be part of a cross-functional development team that works with IT development and support for Scania both locally and globally. We work closely with our customers and throughout the system development process, from concept development to implementation and production.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 You will be part of a cross functional team that works with development and customization of Scania's CAD/PLM platform. You will have a central role in our development team and many contact points around Scania's organization. As a developer, you are involved in requirements work, development, testing, and release management.
   

  

 Together with the other teams, you work in close collaboration with product and process owners on issues that concern functional guidelines - in both short and in long term.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 As a CAD/PLM developer you work with both backend and frontend development. Apart from being an amazing developer you also need to be curious about the function of the system from a user perspective. We believe that you have knowledge of object oriented programming. Furthermore, we believe that you have:
   

  

  

* Extensive experience of implementation from 3DExperience portfolio.
* Experience in at least some of the following technologies: Java, C++, WSO2, SQL, JavaScript, Python, GitLab, Jira.
* Migration from Catia V5 to Catia 3Dx is meritorious.
* Knowledge of SAFE and Agile way of working.
* Fluency in English.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This is us**
 Although we are a competent and professional team, we do not take ourself too seriously! We offer you a fun, interesting, challenging and developing journey together with engaged colleagues within IT and business.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Please contact Emil Bolsing (Manager), emil.bolsing@scania.com, or Anna-Carin Markström (Manager), anna-carin.markstrom@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Embedded Software Developer - DWDM Optical Transceivers
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Telecommunications
description:
**Job Description**
 In an increasingly connected world, the pandemic has highlighted just how essential telecom networks are to keeping society running. The
 **Network Infrastructure** 
 group is at the heart of a revolution to connectivity, pushing the boundaries to deliver more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise
   

  

 Join
 **Optical Networks division** 
 , where innovation meets scale in the AI-driven data center era. With the recent acquisition of Infinera, we’ve united two industry leaders to create an optical networking powerhouse—combining cutting-edge technology with proven leadership to redefine the future of connectivity.
   

  

 Infinera is now part of the Nokia Corporation and its subsidiaries. When you apply, the information you share will be handled with care and used only for recruitment purposes within the group.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn**
 Are you early in your software development career and excited about working close to hardware and real-time systems? We're looking for a passionate developer with 1 to 5 years of experience to join our Embedded Software team in Stockholm . This is a great opportunity to grow your skills while contributing to next-generation optical communication technologies.
   

  

 Infinera is developing cutting-edge optical modules with our own in-house ASICs. Learn more about our work here: Infinera XR Optics .
   

  

 You’ll work with a friendly and experienced team developing software for embedded systems. Your daily tasks could include:
   

  

* Supporting the team in bringing up new hardware
* Writing low-level software (like device drivers) in C/C++
* Creating software that runs on real-time operating systems (RTOS)
* Developing and testing new features for optical modules
* Writing embedded applications on Linux
* Participating in software design discussions
* Learning from and sharing knowledge with other developers


**Key Skills And Experience**
* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent education/work experience
* Advanced knowledge in low level C and C++ programming, in embedded execution
* Linux environment, gentoo distribution
* Telecom and MSA standards
* English, written and spoken
* Highly motivated team player
* Have personal drive to solve tasks and issues.
* Drive technical tasks across organization
* Enjoy tight cooperation with the HW development.


 We’re looking for someone who is:
   

  

* Curious and eager to learn new things
* Comfortable programming in C or C++
* Interested in how software interacts closely with hardware
* A good communicator in English (both written and spoken)
* A team player who enjoys collaboration
* Motivated to solve problems and take initiative


 You don’t need to know everything to apply - we’re happy to help you grow! But it’s a bonus if you have experience with:
   

  

* Embedded development tools like Yocto, Git, CMake
* Scripting in Python
* Real-time operating systems (RTOS)
* Hardware interfaces like I2C or SPI
* Linux
* Telecom standards and protocols


 What you will find:
   

  

* A supportive team that values trust and collaboration
* Opportunities to work on real, challenging technology
* A hybrid work model (mix of office and remote work)
* In-house development: work alongside hardware, system architecture, and product teams
* A clear path for growth within an international R&D organization
* Social events and a comfortable office in Marievik, Stockholm


**About Us**
**Come create the technology that helps the world act together**
 Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
   

  

 We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work
   

  

**What we offer**
 Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
   

  

**Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer**
 Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
   

  

* One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
* Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
* Workplace Pride Global Benchmark


 At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
   

  

 Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

title: Marketing Associate (limited)
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

 **PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES**  

  

Join the global leader in digital transformation - SAP - on an exciting marketing and innovation journey! Opening for a recent graduate/early professional to join as Marketing Associate. The contract is for 6+3 months full-time.


SAP is seeking a proactive and highly motivated individual with a passion for b2b marketing and event management to strengthen the Swedish Marketing Team. Gain a unique opportunity to engage with one of the world’s most valuable brand. Support local marketing campaigns through various communication channels to drive brand awareness and create sales opportunities. As the role progresses, put your learning to practice by planning and executing projects within your field of interest.

 **Key responsibilities**

* Event support, from idea and preparation to execution and follow-up
* Campaign-execution related tasks such as data management, content creation incl email, landing pages, SoMe etc), copywriting, proof reading, translation and lead handling
* Manage various digital platforms, social media tools and AI tools
* Perform content management system updates and data analytics reporting
* Raise the level of social activation within SAP by driving initiatives focused on personal branding and social networking
* Collaborate with a range of internal and external stakeholders, including sales teams, agencies and partners

Be part of interesting Nordic Marketing projects  
* 

**Education & Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business and or IT (beneficial but not required)
* Project management skills and an ‘hands-on’ mentality
* Preferably experience with marketing campaigns, copywriting and data handling
* Knowledge about content creation for online media and channels
* Deep interest in social and digital marketing, as well as a strong willingness to learn
* Strong team player who loves to connect & collaborate
* Attention to details to ensure that all materials and communication is of the highest standard
* Enthusiastic and driven with high interest in learning and new technologies
* Positive hands-on and proactive attitude
* The ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines
* Good skills in Microsoft Office applications – in particular Excel and Powerpoint
* Good written and verbal communication skills
* Must be fluent in Swedish and English

 **What Can You Expect?**

* Career progression – begin your professional career at a world-leading technology company
* Be empowered to drive projects that interest you and learn from a wide range of experienced colleagues
* An exciting opportunity to play a role in a busy but innovative marketing team – and build a great CV and personal brand!

  

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now*.*

 **WORK EXPERIENCE**


Newly graduated or 1-2 years of working experience in relevant areas

 **LOCATION**


The position is located in Stockholm, Swede

  

**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Requisition ID: 430986 | Work Area: Administration | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Graduate | Employment Type: Limited Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.
company_description: SAP's purpose is to help the world run better and improve people's lives with sustainability at the core.

title: OT Security Consultant
description:
We are seeking an experienced **Operational Technology (OT) Security Consultant** ( Stockholm – Hybrid, Contract) to lead the delivery and continuous improvement of OT and IT security processes within a complex manufacturing environment. In this role, you will collaborate with Information Security, IT and business teams to assess and mitigate cyber risks, ensuring that security is integrated into every layer of operations. You will act as the key security point of contact on-site, providing expertise on both proactive and reactive security measures while aligning with global security frameworks and business objectives.

**Key Responsibilities & Skills:**

* Drive the implementation of OT security processes, policies, and controls to strengthen cyber resilience within the manufacturing plant.
* Serve as the on-site security liaison for IT and OT projects, ensuring alignment with corporate security frameworks and standards.
* Conduct risk assessments, identify vulnerabilities, and recommend mitigation strategies for IT and OT systems.
* Collaborate with global and regional cybersecurity teams to ensure compliance with information security methodologies.
* Lead and facilitate stakeholder discussions, including technical and non-technical management meetings on security risks and project progress.
* Monitor security threats, regulatory changes, and emerging risks affecting operational technologies and manufacturing processes.
* Support the maintenance and continuous improvement of security policies, standards, procedures, and governance documentation.
* Champion cybersecurity awareness and embed security best practices within operational teams and business processes.
* Assist in the development, testing, and execution of cyber incident response plans specific to manufacturing environments.
* Provide technical input on IT/OT security controls, network segmentation, cloud security, and industrial control system protection.
* Manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously while maintaining a clear focus on deadlines, quality, and business objectives.
* Evaluate internal systems and third-party controls to ensure robust cyber risk management and compliance with global policies.
* Leverage knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure), networking, and OT security tools to enhance technical defenses.
* Apply industry-recognized security frameworks such as NIST CSF, ISO27001, or IEC 62443 to manage cyber risks.
* Hold or actively working towards professional certifications such as CCNA, PMP, CISSP, or similar, with fluency in English .

If interested in the role , Please send your CV to **info@pixelcodetech.co.uk**

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 6 months

Pay: 400,00kr - 500,00kr per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Head of data
description:
##### **Are you our next Head of Data?**


Join us at Kivra! We're looking for someone with a passion for data, a love for solving complex problems, and who thrives in agile development environments. We've grown tremendously and are looking for a Head of Data who, together with a team of motivated data professionals, will shape the future of data at Kivra!


At Kivra, we're building services that connect over 6 million people by providing a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. At the same time, we're saving trees, reducing the paper that's printed and transported by providing a better digital alternative to physical paper communication.

##### **What you'll be doing**


You’ll join Kivra's Data Platform Team as our Head of Data, where you’re directly responsible to lead, mentor, and manage a team of talented data engineers and analytics engineers. You’ll define the roadmap for the team and ensure the delivery of secure, reliable, and scalable data solutions. As part of the Platform Engineering Organization, you’ll drive the vision for how to develop our data platform following platform engineering principles and you’ll work to support the smooth collaboration and communication of all data professionals at Kivra. You'll work in close collaboration with technical leads, product leads, and other stakeholders across the organization. In your new role, you will:

* **Lead, mentor, and manage** a team of data engineers and analytics engineers
* Foster a **culture of growth and collaboration** in the data function, across engineering and analytics
* **Define and execute the data product roadmap**, ensuring alignment with business objectives and user needs
* **Oversee the design, development, and maintenance** of our data platform, including data pipelines, data warehouse, data services, and reporting tools
* **Drive the adoption of best practices** in data governance, data quality, and data security
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams** to understand their data needs, translate them into actionable data solutions, and manage cross-team projects
* **Participate in strategic discussions** about Kivra's overall data architecture and technology stack
* **Evaluate and integrate new data technologies** to enhance our capabilities and efficiency


Our data stack is built on Google Cloud Platform. Tools and technologies we're using include BigQuery, Python, SQL, Kafka, Postgres, Airflow (managed by Astronomer), Tableau, Hex, Grafana, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, GitHub, and more.

##### **Who we're looking for**


Knowledge is important, but so is attitude! Kivra's culture is strongly influenced by kindness, drive, and the willingness to produce high-quality work. How you fit in with your team is super important for us – we thrive on being nice and helpful and always encourage growth.


We think that you:

* Are a **humble leader** with a passion for building robust and impactful data solutions
* Have **experience leading and mentoring** technical teams, ideally in a data-focused role
* Have a **proven understanding of data engineering principles** and best practices
* Are comfortable **defining product strategy** and communicating it effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Have **experience in operational management of** **data platforms** and tools in production environments
* Are a **coach who guides less experienced team members** and analysts in improving their skills
* Have an interest in **data governance, data quality, and data security**, and experience with working with GDPR in data platforms


We also value:

* Working experience as a data engineer, analytics engineer, software developer, or similar role

##### **Additional information**


This role is full-time and our office is based in Stockholm. We encourage in-office collaboration and see that you also want to work on-site approximately 60% of the time. Fluency in English is required and fluency in Swedish is a plus but not required. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor new work permits, but are able to sponsor/renew existing work permits! The interview process will begin week 32.


##### **We Offer**


Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.


Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!

##### **How to apply**


Easy peasy! Just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com.
