title: Systemutvecklare .NET
description:
**Att jobba som systemutvecklare .NET**
 Som systemutvecklare .NET på Skandia får du vara med och utveckla några av våra mest affärskritiska och samhällsnyttiga system, våra bolånesystem och produkter mot privatkunder. Du kommer att tillhöra ett team inom vårt område låna där fokus är på att förbättra våra värdeflöden mot slutkund.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med både nyutveckling och vidareutveckling av våra befintliga system. Du kommer få arbeta genom hela utvecklingskedjan från kravanalys och design till implementation, testautomatisering och innovation.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som sitter i på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm. Teamet består idag av PO, mjukvaruarkitekt, systemutvecklare och produktspecialist. Vi tror på att dela med oss av kunskap, labba och experimentera i vardagen till exempel genom mobprogrammering. Det är viktigt för oss att du som ny kollega snabbt känner dig som en naturlig del av teamet. Vi jobbar med avancerad affärslogik och ett systemlandskap med hög grad av integrationer vilket ger en utmanande och stimulerande vardag. Genom att arbeta aktivt med DevOps och hela tiden förbättra våra verktyg och arbetsflöden för att testa och leverera kod, kan vi utveckla i högt tempo utan att tumma på kvaliteten.
   

  

**Teamet Sitter Med Följande Techstack Idag**
* NET 8/9


 SQL Server
   

  

 Git & REST-API:er
   

  

 Azure DevOps & Octopus Deploy
   

  

 Splunk, NServiceBus & AppDynamics
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till närmaste gruppchef för IT Låna.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person är du målmedveten och tar gärna egna initiativ för förbättringar samtidigt som du att samarbeta i teamet. Du är nyfiken och har en vilja att lära dig både nya domäner och tekniker. I jobbet är du ordningsam och arbetar strukturerat även när tempot är högt. Eftersom vi formar ett nytt team ser du förändring som ett naturligt tillfälle att testa nya idéer och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom .NET/C#. Du har arbetat med SQL server och kan hantera databehandling, till exempel händelse- och meddelandehantering eller schemalagda körningar.
   

  

 Ett grundkrav är att du har en god kommunikativ förmåga både i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Meriterande för rollen är om du har arbetat med verktyg som Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy, Splunk, NServiceBus och AppDynamics.
   

  

 Vi har dessutom påbörjat vår resa med GitHub Copilot och ser det som en självklarhet att du vill ligga i framkant inom AI-stödd systemutveckling.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Stefan Ravelius på stefan.ravelius@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

*Psst.. i och med att det är semestertider kan rekryteringsprocessen dra ut på tiden. Vi kommer återkoppla till dig som senast i mitten av augusti.*
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Software Architect
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

 As a
 **Software Architect** 
 for Web Solutions, you will bring leadership, deep technical knowledge and experience into a team of software, test automation and quality assurance engineers. You will drive software architecture and software design within the department and collaborate across organization. With your architecture leadership you guide and mentor team members and ensure best possible technical landscape for our products.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Apply yourself to and drive technology strategy, software architecture and software design efforts in our web-based solutions, in close collaboration with all of engineering, stakeholders within product and design, and enterprise architects
* Ability to develop strong influential relationships inside the organization, facilitate technology discussions across teams and departments, even outside Engineering
* Take initiatives in how to best develop and maintain good architecture and software design in any existing web-based products, as well as our new generation of web-based solutions
* Build a common understanding within the development team with regards to design patterns, software solution structures, testability, dependencies and interfaces to other systems
* Take a leading role in the team’s planning of new features to drive good architecture and software design together with development teams and stakeholders
* Ensure software architecture, design and performance meets requirements of quality, security, privacy, maintainability, scalability, high availability, compatibility, configurability, etc


**What We're Looking For**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or relevant field
* At least 3 years of working experience in web-based environment as Software Architect
* Proven experience as Software Architect in a product organization for web-based solutions
* Proven experience in architecture, design, building and delivering new software and maintaining existing web solutions, preferably with .NET
* Full stack profile: Solid experience in building high quality web-based solutions
* Solid experience of appropriate deployment platforms for web-based solutions
* Experience with cloud-based deployments and operations, preferably with Microsoft Azure
* Good knowledge of database and other modeling method
* Understanding of software quality assurance principles
* A technical mindset with great attention to details
* Demonstrated ability to take both the long and short view into account when planning and making technical decisions
* Attentiveness and skill in navigating requirements from stakeholders in diverse disciplines
* Interpersonal skills to function effectively in a team environment
* Ability to act with seniority, professionalism and according to the Tobii Dynavox values
* Flexible, collaborative, hands-on approach


 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python & Go), Payment Products
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Payments product team
   

  

 At the heart of Wolt’s evolution from a food delivery service to an expansive super app, the Payment Products Team drives user-centric payment solutions that reshape how customers engage with our platform. You can work at the forefront of Wolt’s growth, where your contributions directly influence the future of payments and unlock new possibilities for customers worldwide.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We are looking for experienced software engineers who can develop production-level
 **microservices** 
 in
 **Python & Go** 
 . In this role, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver robust solutions while leveraging cutting-edge technologies and best practices.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain scalable backend applications, primarily in Python, with increasing use of Go expected in the coming years.
* Design and optimize database schemas, queries, and indexes using SQL databases like PostgreSQL
* Familiarity with asynchronous event processing (Kafka or others)
* Work with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes
* Utilize cloud platforms such as AWS for deploying and scaling applications
* Experience in Kotlin is useful


**What We Value**
* Leadership by Example: Active participation in code reviews, mentoring, and onboarding.
* Autonomy & Ownership: Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
* Proactive Problem Solving: Ability to identify, own, and resolve challenges with minimal guidance.
* Knowledge Sharing: A passion for fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.


 Fluency in English language is mandatory.
   

  

**🌍 Where You’ll Work**
 The role is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 , with the option to work from
 **Helsinki** 
 . We maintain a remote-friendly setup to foster innovation and teamwork.
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 These positions will be filled as soon as we find the right persons, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 Are you curious about our hiring process? Check out our careers page for more info.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Research Engineer in Quantum Computing
description:
**Job Description**
 We seek a research engineer to support teaching and research activities in the area of quantum computing. In particular, the research engineer will support the teaching activities of the DD2367 and DD2368 courses at KTH and further develop methodologies and algorithms for the quantum computer simulators.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A position at a leading technical university that generates knowledge and skills for a sustainable future.
* Engaged and ambitious colleagues along with a creative, international and dynamic working environment
* Work in Stockholm, in close proximity to nature
* Guidance on relocating and settling in KTH and in Sweden .


 Read more about what it's like to work at KTH and our benefits.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Requirements**
* A graduate degree or an advanced level (higher education) in the research subject or equivalent competence.
* We prefer that you have a strong background in quantum computing.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Subject-related skills
* Professional skills
* Awareness of diversity and equal opportunity issues, with specific focus on gender equality
* Collaborative abilities
* Independence
* We prefer that you complete the DD2367 course at KTH.


 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
   

  

**Trade union representatives**
 Contact information to trade union representatives.
   

  

**To apply for the position**
 Log into KTH's recruitment system to apply for this position. You are responsible for ensuring that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad.
   

  

 The application must include:
   

  

* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* Copy of grades from your previous university studies. Translations into English or Swedish if the original documents have not been issued in any of these languages.


 Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

**About The Employment**
 The employment is valid for a limited time according to the agreement - for up to 6 months, with access according to agreement.
   

  

**Other Information**
 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values
   

  

 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
   

  

 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
   

  

 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
   

  

 Disclaimer:
 *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.*
 About KTH KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm has grown to become one of Europe’s leading technical and engineering universities, as well as a key centre of intellectual talent and innovation. We are Sweden’s largest technical research and learning institution and home to students, researchers and faculty from around the world. Our research and education covers a wide area including natural sciences and all branches of engineering, as well as architecture, industrial management, urban planning, history and philosophy. Read more here

title: Mjukvaruingenjör till försvarsbranschen
description:
Vill du vara en del av en stor teamleverans till en av HiQs största kunder och samtidigt bidra till ett säkrare samhälle?
   

  

 Vi söker nu dig som är ingenjör som har djup förståelse för teknik och några års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling i Java eller C# och. I den här rollen kommer du ingå i ett team med erfarna kollegor som alla har hög kompetens inom området.
   

  

 För att trivas hos oss och i rollen tror vi att du som person är flexibel, du räds inte för att göra det som behövs och har förmåga att både samarbeta med andra och arbeta självständigt. Det faller dig naturligt att leverera resultat med hög kvalité och att lösa kundens problem är din högsta prioritet.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Högskole-/Civilingenjörsexamen inom datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling inom Java eller C#.
* Då arbetet kan omfattas av sekretess krävs Svenskt medborgarskap och att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.
* Möjlighet att jobba på plats på kontoret 3-5 dagar i veckan


**Varför HiQ**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ varit konsultbolaget som förenklat världen för både kunder och slutanvändare med hjälp av teknik, design och kommunikation. HiQ har alltid fokuserat på två saker: att ha kul på jobbet och att leverera lösningar utöver förväntningar - det är vad som driver oss framåt! Vi HiQare är vi stolta över att ha en kultur som präglas av
 **resultat** 
 ,
 **ansvar, enkelhet** 
 och
 **glädje** 
 . Vi tror på att arbeta tillsammans för att nå våra gemensamma mål och strävar efter att hjälpa varandra att fortsätta växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du utöver chansen att utveckla din egen kompetens också möjlighet att lära, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering tillämpar vi löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**Join GlobalConnect as a Senior Network Engineer**
*Are you a Network and/or Systems Engineer looking to gain hands-on experience with secure SD-WAN/FW/LAN/WiFi overlay network platforms?*
*Are you already working with and wish to become even better in Fortinet, HPE Aruba, and Versa Networks SD-WAN, Firewall and LAN/WiFi technologies? And you might already have experience in managing large IP networks and you are eager to evolve your skill set by working with these platforms and solutions with great colleagues, then we have an opportunity for you!*
**About Us**
 We are a Nordic team of highly skilled technical specialists responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our extensive portfolio of software defined and centrally managed secure overlay network platforms. We boast one of the fastest-growing fiber networks in the Nordics, with services like WiFi Access, LAN Access, Firewalls, and SD-WAN in high demand. To keep pace, we're expanding our team with an experienced network specialist/engineer. Does that sound interesting?
   

  

 Our network plays a key role in the infrastructure in Scandinavia. To give it perspective, we cover more than 50% of Scandinavia’s internet connections including internet to hospitals, small, medium and big enterprise businesses, government functions, etc. Therefore, ensuring stability, security, and scalability of the network infrastructure will be super important and staying up to date with industry trends and new technologies to drive innovation and efficiency in the network environment.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a Senior Network Engineer, you'll spearhead technical service development for managed services and collaborate with a team of dedicated and skilled colleagues to create scalable and dynamic solutions. We focus on your personal and professional development, and it is important for us that you have access to learning material and sparring with colleagues across the Nordics, as we know the importance of having fun at work while learning and developing your skills.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Interface with product management to align services with customer needs and best practices.
* Drive service development projects
* Develop and document services, ensuring platform ownership and life cycle management.
* Stay ahead of market trends and best practices.
* Lead design of platforms and technical solutions.
* Act as an expert, bridging organizational needs with suppliers.
* Ideally hands-on project experience working with SASE solutions.


**Why Join Us?**
 This is a social role with many internal contacts where you'll act as a knowledge sharer. Help lead the way in a constantly evolving network at one of Nordics' most expansive operators.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.
